title: nude_filter
body:
An image that has been [[third-party edit|edited]] to remove a character's clothes, or to make them [[nude]].

Nude filters are against the [[help:upload rules|upload rules]] and should not be uploaded or approved.

If the image has been redrawn (ie a trace) instead of an edit over the original, then this tag should not be used and the image should instead be tagged [[derivative work]].

h4. See also

* [[third-party edit]]
* [[help:upload rules]]

title: inging_motorsport
body:
A Japanese motorsport team that participates in [[Super GT]] and the [[Super Formula Championship]]. Often sponsored by [[Project Mu]].

The team's mascot is [[Yamaguchi Miu]], who has appeared in [[itasha]] liveries for the team's [[racecar]]s since 2012.

title: kobayashi_kamui_(racecar_driver)
body:
Japanese [[racecar]] driver, currently one of [[Toyota Gazoo Racing]]'s [[Toyota GR010|GR010]] drivers in the [[World Endurance Championship]] and a [[super formula championship|Super Formula]] driver for KCMG. He is a former [[Formula One]] driver and made his [[NASCAR]] debut in 2023.

Kobayashi is an accomplished endurance racer, as a 3 time WEC champion and overall winner at the 2021 [[circuit de la sarthe|24 Hours of Le Mans]].

title: cattleya_(queen's_blade)
body:
[b]Cattleya[/b] (カトレア) is a [[Queen's Blade]] character. Voiced by [[Yuzuki Ryouka]], designed by [[Kaneko Hiraku]]. She is a blacksmith, weapons store owner and a former adventurer with [[huge breasts]]. She has black hair tied into a ponytail, blue eyes, and glasses. Fights with swords and spears. She entered the Queen's Blade tournament to find her missing husband. Has a young son named [[rana (queen's blade)|Rana]].

Rather unusually, Cattleya is one of, if not, the most popular character of the franchise, despite it featuring wide array of casts for general appeal. Primarily due to her volpulous and motherly appearance (to the point that one of her Pixiv tag is "120cm", referring to the official measurement of her [[huge breasts]]). Which lead into her being featured in numerous [[mature female|MILF]] works.

Cattleya's battle book: pool #743

h4. Variations

* [[weapon_merchant_cattleya|Cattleya (Weapon Merchant)]]
* [[Cattleya (Queen's Blade Unlimited)]]

h4. See also

* "Other characters named Cattleya":[/tag?name=cattleya*&type=&order=date]

title: silpheed_(series)
body:
A series of [[starfighter]] combat video games. Created by Game Arts.

Silpheed is the main game in the series, featuring several different equipments, Base Infiltration and Boss Fights.

the Sega CD sequel retains most of the equipment on the first series, but in better used of a CG like pre-rendered animation while retaining the vertical shooter itself.

Silpheed: The Lost Planet; the story starts an invasion of an alien force, which all Silpheed spacecraft must save the galaxy against the occurrence of an unknown Alien lifeforms in the galaxy, this sequel is published by Capcom.

Project Sylpheed; is the successor of the Silpheed games but in the most Ace combat style of gameplay, the Sylpheed fighter is called the Delta Saber, which is similar to the SA-77 Silpheed from its previous appearances.


h4. Entries
* [[Silpheed]]
* [[Silpheed: The Lost Planet]]
* [[Project Sylpheed]]

title: silpheed
body:
A [[science fiction]] space shooter [[video game]] developed by Game Arts and designed by Miyaji Takeshi.

It made its debut on the Japanese PC-8801 in 1986, and was ported to the Fujitsu FM-7 and MS-DOS formats soon after. It was later remade for the [[Sega CD]] in 1993 and has a sequel called [i]Silpheed: The Lost Planet[/i] released for the [[PlayStation 2]] in 2000.

[[Silpheed_(spaceship)|]] is the name of the [[spacecraft]] that the player controls. Like many shooter games, the story involves using the Silpheed as Earth's last effort to save itself from destruction by a powerful enemy invasion known as Xacalite.

the Gloire is the Mothership of the Invasion forces, as it written, only the Silpheed space fighter can destroy it and save the galaxy.

title: kamen_rider_2_(shin)
body:
h6. Batta Augment 02, Ichimonji Hayato.

A former freelance photographer, Hayato was augmented by the organization SHOCKER into a prana-using cyborg. Possessing the ability to transform into his combat mode without the need for speed, he is considered superior to the original Batta Augment, [[kamen rider 1 (shin) |01]].

He derives his happiness from freedom.

title: ginban_kaleidoscope
body:
[b]Ginban Kaleidoscope[/b] (Skating Rink Kaleidoscope) was a Japanese Romance Light novel that ran for 9 volumes from 2003 to 2006 and was later adapted into a 12 episode anime in 2005 by Studio Karaku, now known as Actas.

The plot follows [[Sakurano Tazusa]], a Japanese Olympic figure skating candidate, whose body gets inhabited by [[Pete Pumps]], a Canadian stunt pilot after he does during a stunt gone wrong at the same time when Tazusa was competing in Canada.

title: vf-4
body:
A [[variable fighter]] mecha from the [[MACROSS]] universe. 

The [b]VF-4 Lightning III[/b] is the succesor to the [[VF-1]] manned transformable aerospace mecha from [[choujikuu_yousai_macross|The Super Dimension Fortress Macross]]. It first appeared in the [[Macross Flashback 2012]] OVA from 1987. Early prototypes had the [[VFX-4]] designation.

The [i]Lightning[/i] is faster, more maneuverable, can generate more thrust than the standard VF-1 [i]Valkyrie[/i], and is armed with internal missile bays and dual beam [[arm cannon]]s in addition to the same traditional GU-11 [[gunpod]] found in the VF-1. 

More advanced variants included improved thermonuclear engines and an additional head-mounted laser cannon for defense. It was eventually succeeded by the [[VF-11]] [i]Thunderbolt[/i] several years later.

In [[real life]] the VF-4 was designed by [[Kawamori Shouji]] in the 80s.

The mecha was called the [b]VF-4 Lightning Veritech[/b] in the [[Robotech]] adaptation.

body:
Titular character of the anime/manga series [[Machikado Mazoku]]. She is a newly awakened [[demon girl]] with [[brown eyes]] and [[brown hair]] (red in the anime) along with [[horns]] and a [[demon tail]].

Her demonic alias is '[b]Shadow Mistress Yuuko[/b]' (シャドウミストレス優子), shortened by others to [b]Shamiko[/b] (シャミ子).  
Similar to magical girls, she can magically transform into a revealing [[Crisis Management Form (MachiMazo)|Crisis Management Form]] costume to enhance her abilities.

She has [[blue eyes]] and [[orange hair|red hair]], which she wears in a [[long hair|long]] [[ponytail]].
She wears a [[school uniform]] with a [[red necktie]] and [[grey skirt|grey]] [[pleated skirt]], a [[letterman jacket|varsity jacket]], [[black shorts|black]] [[bike shorts]] [[bike shorts under skirt|under her skirt]], [[white socks|white]] [[socks|calf-highs]], and [[blue footwear|blue]] [[sneakers]].

Her preferred weapon is a [[baseball bat]].

title: mortal_kombat_trilogy
body: The last classic [[Mortal Kombat (series)|]] game, using a variant of Ultimate Mortal Kombat 3's engine. Features all the characters from the previous games, Mortal Kombat, Mortal Kombat 2, Mortal Kombat 3, and Ultimate Mortal Kombat 3. Has two versions based on the first two releases, the PlayStation and Nintendo 64, which feature some differences. Also the last Mortal Kombat game sold in Japan until the 2010s with [[Mortal Kombat X|Mortal Kombat Mobile]] and select digital storefronts.

title: toudou_naoya
body:
Main protagonist of [[Persona 1]], known as [b]The Pierced Boy[/b] in his debut game and [b]Boy with Earring[/b] in [[Persona 2]]. The manga adaptation calls him [b]Toudou Naoya[/b]. He is noted for his bluntness and natural-born leadership skills.

Fans tend to call him [b]Pierce[/b] (ピアス) after his full title in Japanese (ピアスの少年, [i]Piasu no Shounen[/i]).

His Persona is [[The Emperor (tarot)|]].

title: mortal_kombat_11
body:
The 11th mainline [[Mortal Kombat (series)|]] game, and the third game in the post-Armageddon rebooted series.

Follows directly after [[Mortal Kombat X]], and ends with the creation of a new timeline, which is the setting of [[Mortal Kombat 1 (2023)]].

title: mortal_kombat_x
body:
The 10th mainline [[Mortal Kombat (series)|]] game, and the second game in the post-Armageddon rebooted series. Has a mobile release, known as Mortal Kombat (Mobile) since 2019, that is available officially in Japan.

Set 20 years after [[Mortal Kombat 9]], and followed by [[Mortal Kombat 11]].
other_names: モータルコンバットモバイル
モータルコンバットXモバイル

title: mortal_kombat_9
body:
The 9th mainline [[Mortal Kombat (series)|]] game, and the first game in the post-Armageddon rebooted series.

Receiving info from the future, Raiden attempts to change the past during the events of the first three MK games, changing the timeline. Followed up by [[Mortal Kombat X]], set 20 years later.

body:
[[Maid]] uniform worn by waitresses at the Trés Bien cafe in the [[Ace Attorney]] series, first introduced in [[Phoenix Wright: Ace Attorney - Trials and Tribulations]].

It consists of either a [[red bow|red]] [[hair bow]] or a [[maid headdress]]; a [[short dress|short]] [[orange dress|orange]] [[dress]] with a [[collared dress|collar]], [[puffy short sleeves]], [[center frills]] and [[buttons]]; a [[red bowtie|red]] [[bowtie]], and a [[white apron|white]] [[frilled apron|frilled]] [[maid apron|maid]] [[apron]] with a [[white bow|white]] [[back bow|bow at the back]] and a single [[pocket]].

h4. Notable wearers
* [[Maggey Byrde]]
* [[Maya Fey]]
* [[Mia Fey]]
* [[Viola Cadaverini]]
* [[Athena Cykes]]

title: ramune
body:
A carbonated soft [[drink]] sold in Japan, typically in "Codd-neck":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Codd-neck_bottle] [[bottle]]s. The original formula is lemon-lime; nowadays there are many other flavors as well. At least one manufacturer labels it "Ramuné" for the North American market, indicating how it's meant to be pronounced.

For the game and anime, use the tag [[Lamune]].

h4.See also

* [[Tag Group:Food Tags]]

title: misako_(kunio-kun)
body:
One of the two main characters from [[River City Girls]] (which is part of the [[Kunio-kun series|Kunio-kun]] franchise of beat 'em up games), alongside [[Kyoko (kunio-kun)|Kyoko]].

She has [[pink eyes]] and [[short hair|short]] [[black hair]], and uses [[lipstick]].
She wears a [[school uniform]] with a [[red necktie]] and [[black shorts|black]] [[high-waist shorts|high-waist]] [[culottes|culotte shorts]], [[green thighhighs|green]] [[thighhighs]], and [[loafers]].

Her preferred weapons are [[brass knuckles]].

title: galil_ace
body:
The [B]IWI Galil ACE[/B] is a series of [B][[assault rifle]]s[/B] and [B][[battle rifle]]s[/B] originally developed and manufactured by "Israel Weapon Industries":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Israel_Weapon_Industries]. Mainly available in three different calibers: 5.56×45mm NATO, 7.62×39mm and 7.62×51mm NATO. 

The design is based upon the original [[IMI Galil]], but has a modern design to increase its accuracy and lower its weight, while maintaining the original Galil's ergonomics, ease of maintenance and reliability under battle conditions.

h4. See also
* [[Kalashnikov rifle]]
* [[List of Weapons]]
* Wikipedia: "IWI ACE":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IWI_ACE]

The name came from Shisei-juu, one of the Japanese names for "The Chinese Four Symbols":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Four_Symbols_%28China%29].

title: iron_throne
body:
The iconic [[throne]] depicted in the fantasy novel series [i][[A Song of Ice and Fire]][/i] by [[George R.R. Martin]] and its associated TV show [i][[Game of Thrones]][/i]. Said to be forged from the swords of Targaryen ruler Aegon the Conqueror's enemies and fused by dragonfire.

The throne as depicted in the TV show has been as accepted as the definite version and a symbol for the entire media franchise, despite not being the one in George R. R. Martin's imagination, one that is tall, large enough to fill most of a room, having stairs, and being haphazardly made, which would be too expensive and too large to feasibly recreate in reality, let alone be used in even the largest indoor sets for the TV series. [[Marcsimonetti|Marc Simonetti]]'s Throne (post #6286993) has been described to be the closest to Martin's vision.

h4. Further reading:
* "Wikipedia: Iron Throne ([i]A Song of Ice and Fire[/i])":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Iron_Throne_(A_Song_of_Ice_and_Fire)]

The story tells about [[Iria (zeiram)|]], the Bounty hunter that wants to fight against the mysterious life form called [[Zeiram]], which killed her brother while discovering political conspiracies.

title: d1_grand_prix
body:
A Japanese [[car]] [[drifting]] [[racecar|motorsports]] series. Founded in 2001, the series eventually expanded internationally to have leagues in the United States, United Kingdom, Malaysia, and New Zealand. The US and UK leagues are both currently defunct, with the two regions having unrelated but still very popular drifting series in [[Formula Drift]] and European Drift Championship respectively.

Like [[Super GT]], D1GP is also notable for featuring [[race queen]]s despite their decreased presence in other motorsports.

title: autocycle
body:
A portmanteau of [i][[car|automobile]][/i] and [i][[motorcycle]][/i].  It is a US legal term referring to [[three-wheeler]]s that feature car-like steering, car-like passenger seating, and some degree of passenger compartment.  In the US they can not legally be classified a car, but a classification was needed to cover car-like three-wheelers that are different from motorcycle-like three-wheelers.

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Three-wheeler - Registration":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Three-wheeler#Registration]

title: two-fingered_typing
body:
[[Typing]] on a computer or typewriter keyboard using both index fingers. Better known as [i]Hunt and Peck[/i] typing due to most people who type in this manner being inexperienced with typing on a keyboard who must "hunt" for the key they're looking for and then will "peck" it with their index finger.  Some self-taught users may still use this type of typing even after having becoming familiar with the computer keyboard.

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Typing - Techniques: Hunt and Peck":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Typing#Hunt_and_peck]

title: nijihub_(meme)
body:
Portmanteau of [[PornHub]] and [[Nijisanji]]. A [[meme]] spawned from a derivative of [[Nijisanji EN]]'s [[Pomu Rainpuff]]'s own NSFW [[Twitter]] hashtag (#pomuhub), which later became the the de facto NSFW tag of Nijisanji [[virtual youtuber]]s.

In the "classic" Nijihub depictions, the meme outfit consists small [[black bikini]] with "Niji" in white text on the right breast and "hub" styled like the PornHub logo on the left breast and being worn by a Nijisanji [[virtual youtuber]] talent, in a similar vein to the official PornHub bikini.  The strings connecting the bikini may be black or white.

title: nase_hidehito
body:
Supporting chracter from [i][[Umamusume: Cinderella Gray]][/i]. He is [[Bamboo Memory (umamusume)|]]'s [[trainer (umamusume)|]] in the continuity of Cinderella Gray.

Given that he is [[nase fumino|Fumino]]'s father, and his nick name being "The wizard of the turf", it is most likely that he is based off of Take Kunihiko, the father of [[Take Yutaka]], who Fumino's character is likely based off of.

title: deedlit
body:
CV: [[Touma Yumi]] (1990 OVA), Niiyama Shiho -> Noda Junko (after Niiyama's passing) (1998 anime)

Character from [[Record of Lodoss War]]. As a high [[Elf]], Deedlit is in touch with nature and draws from its essence for her magic, although she also excels at swordplay. Starting from the 1990 OVA, she falls in love with [[Parn (Lodoss)|Parn]] rather fast, and eventually starts dating him.

As with many other examples from [i]Lodoss[/i], Deedlit codified the appearance of elves in Japanese fantasy with her [[long pointy ears|long]] [[pointy ears]]. She also has [[long hair|long]] [[blonde hair]] and [[green eyes]].

title: camus_(fire_emblem)
body:
An antagonist who appears in [[Fire Emblem: Shadow Dragon and The Blade of Light]] and its remakes. Known for his unwavering loyalty to his homeland, Grust, he leads the country’s Sable Order and also rescued [[Nyna (Fire Emblem)|]] from captivity.

Later returns in [[Fire Emblem Gaiden]] and its remake as a playable character under the name [b]Zeke[/b], becoming an amnesiac Rigelian general who was rescued by [[Tatiana (Fire Emblem)|]] and fell in love with. After regaining his memories, Camus returns one final time in [[Fire Emblem: Mystery of The Emblem]] Book II, donning a mask and calling himself [b]Sirius[/b]. Afterwards, he vanishes from Archanea, presumably returning to Valentia where Tatiana waits for him.

All three of his identities have a consistent appearance: [[medium hair|medium]], [[blonde hair]], a [[black coat]] with white [[frills]] and [[gold trim]], a [[black cape]] with a red/magenta inside, and [[black footwear]] with [[black gloves]]. As Sirius, he additionally wears a white [[mask]].

title: goku_luck_(paradox_live)
body:
A group of singers in [[Paradox Live]].

In prison, their skills were acknowledged by taking the top ranks in Prison Rap. Heavy rap is let out based on dissatisfaction to society and anger to its circumstances. They overwhelmed the stage with abundant individuality and a radical lyricism.

h6. Members:
* [[Inukai Yuto]]
* [[Tosa Ryoga]]
* [[Kaida Shion]]
* [[Mikoshiba Kenta]]

title: 1nm8_(paradox_live)
body:
A group of singers in [[Paradox Live]].

Three people who have an extremely high affinity for phantoms and can produce unique illusions. Kei, the leader of the group, used to be the center of VISTY, but left the group for one reason or another, and now the three of them live under one roof. The unworldly atmosphere that the three of them create moves the hearts of those who listen to them.

h6. Members:
* [[Miyama Kei]]
* [[Itsuki (paradox live)|]]
* [[Rokuta (paradox live)|]]

title: amprule_(paradox_live)
body:
A duo of singers in [[Paradox Live]].

2MCs consisting of Yeon Dongha, the younger brother of Hajun, and Baek Chungsung, the Yeon family butler. Crushing BAE’s Hajun in the phantom live and grabbing the mic to reign as the absolute champion. Their music features solemn and elegant tracks, and aggressive and poisonous lyrics.

h6. Members:
* [[Yeon Dongha]]
* [[Baek Chungsung]]

title: visty_(paradox_live)
body:
A group of singers in [[Paradox Live]].

An idol group who suffered a great fall from fame due to the sudden withdrawal of their center member at the height of their popularity. While each member excels in their abilities, they are left in the shadow of their loss, treated as leftovers. With everything to lose, these idols are betting it all on this one last chance to prove themselves.

h6. Members:
* [[Yamato Shogo]]
* [[Hikage Toma]]
* [[Kureha Aoi]]
* [[Misuji Kantaro]]

title: buraikan_(paradox_live)
body:
A duo in [[Paradox Live]].

* [[Shingu Haruomi]]

title: cozmez_(paradox_live)
body:
A duo of [[twins|twin]] [[brothers]] in [[Paradox Live]].

Orphans that grew up without knowing their parents’ faces. After escaping their orphanage, they survived by entering stage battles to earn prize money. They trust each other fully, having depended on the other's support to survive. Their songs call for empathy with downer, compelling, and realistic lyrics spun from their heavy upbringing.

h6. Members:
* [[Yatonokami Kanata]]
* [[Yatonokami Nayuta]]

title: the_cat's_whiskers_(paradox_live)
body:
A group of singers in [[Paradox Live]].

With old friends and work partners Saimon and Kanbayashi standing at the center, Ryuu and Shiki joined to form the current team. They are usually working at the jazz bar “Bar 4/7” (Bar Seven Four) owned by Saimon. Highly regarded for their evergreen compositions with a jazzy core.

h6. Members:
* [[Saimon Naoakira]]
* [[Kanbayashi Yohei]]
* [[Natsume Ryu]]
* [[Ando Shiki]]
other_names: ザ・キャッツウィスカーズ

title: bae_(paradox_live)
body:
A group of singers in [[Paradox Live]].

Formed by three people studying at the same private international university. Believes in living life by being true to themselves without being bound by practicality and rigid concepts. The three of them share Hajun’s high class flat. Takes pride in making use of Japanese, English, and Korean in genreless, trendy HIPHOP.

h6. Members:
* [[Sugasano Allen]]
* [[Yeon Hajun]]
* [[Anne Faulkner]]

title: abe_no_seimei_(onmyoji)
body:
Protagonist and playable character in [[Onmyoji]], based on historical figure Abe no Seimei.

An amnesiac but peerless [[onmyouji]] of the Heian period. Sophisticated and powerful, watches over the safety of the capital Heian-kyō, along fellow playable onmyoji [[Kagura (onmyoji)|]], [[Minamoto no Hiromasa (onmyoji)|Hiromasa]], [[Yao bikuni (onmyoji)|Yaobikuni]], and his various [[shikigami]].

Has [[blue eyes]] with red [[makeup]] around them, [[white hair|white]] [[long hair]] tied with a [[ribbon]]. Usually seen wearing a [[tate eboshi]], [[japanese clothes]] ([[kariginu]]) with [[long sleeves]], [[bridal gauntlets]] covered by [[prayer beads]] and carrying a [[folding fan]].

h4. External links
* "Official site bio":[https://en.onmyojigame.com/onmyoji/]

title: nightbird_(transformers)
body:
A female [[mecha]]'s name from the [[Transformers]] franchise that first appeared in an episode of the G1 TV series from 1984.

[b]Nightbird[/b] is a sentient female [[ninja]] or [i]kunoichi[/i] giant [[robot]] designed by a [[Japan]]ese [[scientist]] who was inspired by the [[autobot]] designs. In the original cartoon she is silent and never utters a word.

In the original cartoon she does not possess variable geometry and thus can't transform, though later incarnations of Nightbird are typically given a Cybertronian origin, allowing her to transform. In [[transformers: rise of the beasts|Rise of the Beasts]], her vehicle mode is a [[Nissan skyline r33|R33]] [[Nissan Skyline GT-R]].

title: liang_qi
body: In [[Canaan (series)|]], Liang Qi is the right-hand woman of [[Alphard (canaan)|Alphard Alshaya]], a merciless and cruel Chinese assassin who idolizes Alphard to the point of being obsessed with her. She harbors a murderous hatred for [[Canaan (character)|Canaan]] for "changing" her beloved "sister", and is always attempting to kill her.

title: alphard_(canaan)
body: Main antagonist of [[Canaan (series)|]].

title: zas_m21_(white_queen)_(girls'_frontline)
body:
[[Zas M21 (girls' frontline)|]]'s second skin from [[Girls' Frontline]], as part of the 'A Midsummer Night's Fantasy' from 2018 through shop purchase.

For the anniversary, she switches her hairstyle towards [[swept bangs]], adopting a [[black hairband]] with accompanying [[hair ornament]]s. Her attire consists of a black-and-[[white dress|white]] [[layered dress]], with the black serving as its inner color, the white as its outer, showing off her [[bare shoulders]]. Paired with it is a [[black ribbon|black]] [[neck ribbon]], [[white armband|white]] [[frilled armband]]s, [[white gloves]] and [[white thighhighs]], completed with [[white footwear|white]] [[high heels]]. For her namesake gun, she had adopted a custom [[gun sling]], and she is seen with a [[alcohol|half-empty]] [[wine glass]].

title: vhs_(keeper_on_page_8)_(girls'_frontline)
body:
[[VHS (girls' frontline)|]]'s first skin from [[Girls' Frontline]], as part of the 'Operation Dusk' skin collection from 2020 through shop purchase.

For her urban trek, she's put on a [[grey headwear|grey]] [[beanie]] and headphones, trying her [[long hair]] into a [[ponytail]]. She wears a [[green jacket|green]] [[camouflage jacket]], with a [[red scarf]], a [[load bearing vest]], [[orange gloves]], her namesake gun on a [[gun sling]], and carrying a small [[briefcase]]. All of this [[bodysuit under clothes|covers]] her [[blue bodysuit]], with her art emphasizing her [[ass]], complete with [[dimples of Venus]]. Alongside some [[thigh strap]]s and a [[thigh holster]] holding a knife, her attire is complete with [[orange footwear|orange]] [[boots]]. Like her base damaged art, this skin's damaged art also references [[Bite the Dust (jojo)|]], with Killer Queen's recognizable pose.

title: sling_(weapon)
body:
A primitive weapon consisting of a pouch and a length of string. The pouch holds a stone, is spun by the string, and released to launch the projectile.

See [[gun sling]] for a strap for carrying a firearm. See [[arm sling]] for the arm-supporting kind.

body: A being actually meant to represent [[Mizuki Hitoshi]]'s little sister within the context of his strip "Hang in There, Kogasa-san":/pools/2420.  Depicted as a bright green [[karakasa obake]].  As she lives out in (relatively) rural Kōchi on Japan's Shikoku Island, she's shown a strong desire to take in standard tourist traps, such as  [[Tokyo Disneyland]] and the [[Tokyo Skytree]] (or at least its Sky Town shopping center), when she visits her brother in the big city.

title: akane_canna_(2nd_costume)
body:
The second [[official alternate costume|costume]] of [[Nanashi Inc.]]'s [[Akane Canna]].

Her hair is shorter now, with a [[single sidelock]] and the same [[feather hair ornament]] in addition to [[headphones]] with [[fake animal ears|fake]] [[dog ears]]. Her main outfit consists of an [[oversized clothes|oversized]] [[black coat|black]] [[two-tone coat|and]] [[white coat]] with [[long sleeves]] and several [[lapel pin|pins]] and [[patch]]es, including a [[paw print]], a [[bone]] and a [[warning sign]]. She also has [[pocket]]s, an [[o-ring thigh strap]], and [[white footwear|white]] [[boots]]. 

Underneath her coat, her outfit resembles Suzumi Nemo's [[suzumi nemo (2nd_costume)|2nd costume]] with a [[short sleeves|short-sleeved]] [[white shirt]] [[shirt tucked in|tucked into]] a [[black skirt]], with a [[black belt]], a [[wristband]], and her [[headphones around neck|headphones around her neck]].

body:

She has [[swept bangs|swept]] [[medium bangs|medium-length bangs]] with a [[braid]] on her left side tied with a [[white bow|white]] [[hair bow]], a [[black headwear|black]] [[plaid headwear|plaid]] [[beret]] with [[hat_feather]]s, and [[multiple earrings]]. Her main outfit consists of a [[cropped jacket|cropped]] [[open jacket|open]] [[orange jacket]] with [[short sleeves]] over a [[white shirt|white]] [[strapless shirt]] and a [[black corset]], with a [[detached collar|detached]] [[white collar]] and a [[purple necktie]] and [[bangle]]s. On her [[back bow|back]] is a [[large bow|large]] [[orange bow]] that is attached to her [[orange shorts|orange]] [[short shorts]]. Her footwear is [[brown footwear|brown]] [[high heel boots]].

Her hair is fairly [[messy hair|messy]] with [[hair intakes]] and a [[wing hair ornament]]. Her main outfit consists of a [[torn scarf|torn]] [[yellow scarf]], a [[sleeveless shirt|sleeveless]] [[white shirt]] with a [[button gap]] for her [[cleavage]] and [[midriff|mid]][[navel|riff]], a [[red jacket|red]] and [[purple jacket|purple]] [[plaid jacket|plaid]] [[two-sided jacket]] [[jacket partially removed|partially removed]] with its [[zipper]]s closed, and a [[single pauldron]]. She also wears a [[red skirt|red]] [[suspender skirt|suspender]] [[pencil skirt]] with a [[loose belt|loose]] [[brown belt]] and a wider [[black belt]], a [[single thighhigh|single]] [[white thighhighs|white thighhigh]] with a [[thigh strap]], and [[black footwear|black]] [[fur-trimmed footwear|fur-trimmed]] [[boots]].

title: gelgoog_marine
body:
[b]MS-14F Gelgoog Marine[/b]
A refitted, higher performing variant of the [[Gelgoog]] [[mobile suit]] designed for spec ops use. With more thruster power, beefier armor, arm-mounted guns, a spike shield for melee combat and a versatile array of weapons including two types of beam rifles and a more standard beam saber as opposed to the flashy twin beam sword, it was truly a powerful machine even in the rapidly escalating environment of [[gundam_0083|Operation Stardust]].

title: sega_mega_drive_mini
body:
The [b]Sega Mega Drive Mini[/b], known as the [b]Sega Genesis Mini[/b] in regions outside of Japan, is a dedicated console modeled on the original [[Sega Mega Drive]] [[game console]] from 1988. It is published by [[SEGA]] and produced by [[m2_(company)|M2]]. 

The Mini emulates the original console's 16-bit hardware, and includes 42 games, all ported by M2. 

It was released in North America and [[Japan]] in September 2019, and in Europe and the Middle East the following month.

A second model with more games and a different external design was released in 2022.

title: 1943_the_battle_of_midway
body:
[b]1943: The [[Battle of Midway]][/b] is a 1987 shoot 'em up arcade game developed and published by Capcom. It was the first followup to Capcom's earlier [[1942 (game)|]].

[b]1943 Mark II: The Battle of Midway[/b] is an  "alternate" version of the original 1943.

The game is set in the Pacific theater of [[World War II]], off the coast of the Midway Atoll. The goal is to attack the Japanese Striking Force (機動部隊 [i]kidou butai[/i]), fly through the 16 stages of play, and make their way to the Japanese battleship Yamato and destroy her.

h5. List of Boss in stages

Stage 1: [[tone_(cruiser)|Tone]]
Stage 2: [[kaga_(aircraft_carrier)|Kaga]]
Stage 3: "Ayako":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nakajima_G8N] (亜也虎)
Stage 4: [[fusou_(battleship)|Fusou]]
Stage 5: [[akagi_(aircraft_carrier)|Akagi]]
Stage 6: [[ki-67|Daihiryuu]] (大飛龍)
Stage 7: [[ise_(battleship)|Ise]]

title: senjou_no_ookami_ii
body:
[b]Senjō no Ōkami II[/b] (戦場の狼II, [b][i]Wolf of the Battlefield II[/i][/b]), also known as [b]MERCS[/b] outside [[Japan]], is a run and gun [[video game]] developed and published for the [[arcade]]s by [[Capcom]] in 1990. 

It is a sequel to the 1985 arcade video game hit [b]Commando[/b] (known as [[Senjou no Ookami]] in Japan). 

While not as successful as its predecessor, Mercs was well received by critics and was a moderate commercial success. It received a port for the [[Sega Mega Drive]] home console in 1991 and was followed by a downloadable game sequel called [[Wolf of the Battlefield: Commando 3]] in 2008.

title: samantha_tan_racing
body:
A Canadian motorsports team affiliated with [[BMW]]. Participates in multiple series including [[GT World Challenge America]], [[GT World Challenge Europe]] (in collaboration with [[Ferrari]]-based team Rinaldi Racing), 24H Series, and the [[Nurburgring]] Endurance Series.

Notable for scoring the GT3 [[BMW M4]]'s first overall victory at the 2022 12H Mugello. ST Racing's [[racecar]]s primarily feature liveries based on iconic Vincent Van Gogh paintings.

title: scaramouche's_sickly_friend_(genshin_impact)
body:
A nameless [[child]] who is featured in [[Genshin Impact]].

He was [[Scaramouche (genshin impact)|]]'s friend in the past and the child of crafts-people located in Tatarasuna. He promised Scaramouche that they could live together as family, but ultimately broke his promise once he passed from his illness. 

Scaramouche viewed his death as a "betrayal."

title: amai_hiyo
body:
An artist-turned-[[indie virtual youtuber|indie]] [[virtual YouTuber]]. A sweet-loving girl who calls her fans/listeners "nii-nii" (shortened from "onii-chan"). She is a fast learner who've learned English and Spanish to communicate with her fans, as well as had a sizeable knowledge of western meme culture.

Her original appearance consist her wearing a [[serafuku]] with a [[beret]] with a 4-leaf clover symbol on it. She has a medium-length brown-hair in [[low twintails]] and [[brown eyes]].

On August 29, 2020 Hiyo debuted her new character design. Aside that her hair becomes slightly messier and thicker is she has [[cat ears]] and [[cat tail]], as well as a 4-leaf clover shaped pupil. She now wear a dress with a buruma underneath along with white thighhighs.

Her third design, revealed on February 2021, consisted of a white [[jacket]], a pink [[camisole]] and a pink short pants.

Her fourth design features a much smaller figure (akin to a [[child]]), wearing a pink dress and with a shorter hair.

Her fifth design, revealed on Christmas 2022, features a drastic character change, as she is now depicted as an adult with [[large breasts]] and [[very long hair]]. Her outfit consists of a black-and-white [[china dress]] optionally worn over with a [[off shoulder]] [[short dress]].

h4. See Also
* [[Ekakibito]] - her artist pen name.

h4. External Links

* Youtube: "Channel Page":https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC04QM30wwa0qMs101Mwz29w
* "Twitter":https://twitter.com/amaihiyo

title: type_94_shiranui
body:
[[Mecha]] from [[Muv-Luv Alternative]]. The Type 94 Shiranui is a fully Japanese-produced [[tactical surface fighter]] and the first ever third-generation TSF introduced. While they're primarily used by Imperial Japanese forces, Shiranui models were also adopted by Japan-based UN forces.

The machine was used as the development base for the [[XFJ-01a Shiranui]].
other_names: 不知火(マブラヴオルタネイティヴ)

title: type_00_takemikazuchi
body:
[[Mecha]] from [[Muv-Luv Alternative]]. The Takemikazuchi is a 3rd generation [[tactical surface fighter]] utilized by the Empire of Japan and exclusively piloted by members of the Shogunate and the Imperial Royal Guard.

Four main variants of the unit exist in the series:
* [b]Type-00R[/b]: Usually blue or purple, features a set of eyes. The purple version is heavily featured in the series' promotional material.
* [b]Type-00F[/b]: Usually red or yellow, features an [[assault visor]]. Piloted by [[Tsukuyomi Mana]] in Alternative and [[Takamura Yui]] in [[muv-luv total eclipse|Total Eclipse]].
* [b]Type-00A[/b]: Painted in white, otherwise visibly identical to the 00F.
* [b]Type-00C[/b]: Painted in grey and a featuring a simplified head unit. Used by Imperial Guard pilots from commoner families.

title: kimi_ga_nozomu_eien
body:
Visual novel developed by âge and released in 2001. An anime adaptation aired in 2003, and an OVA adapting one of the VN's other routes was released between 2007 and 2008.

The series is set in the same continuity as [[Kimi ga Ita Kisetsu]] and [[Muv-Luv]], and has a short comedy-focused spinoff in [[Akane Maniax]].

The anime adaptation was licensed by Funmation in America, who released it under the title [b]Rumbling Hearts[/b]. An official English translation of the VN was announced in 2020, and the title of the release was later revealed to be [b]The Eternity You Desire[/b]. There is currently no set release window for the VN translation.

h4. Characters

title: cobra_(space_adventure_cobra)
body:
The titular character of [[Space Adventure Cobra]]. A famous space pirate that erased his own memories and got plastic surgery to change his face in an effort to put his dangerous life behind him. He suddenly begins to regain his memories, however, and begins his adventures anew. 

Best-known for his distinctive [[arm cannon]], the "[[Psychogun]]". It channels Cobra's mental energies into a laser beam that can be controlled freely. He has a prosthetic forearm to cover the cannon when not in use.

title: toasting_(gesture)
body:
A social custom in which a drink (usually of [[alcohol]]) is taken to honor a person or to celebrate an occasion. A toast may involve two people touching their [[drinking glass|drinking glasses]] together, or simply raising their glasses in the air.

A toast is often accompanied by a verbal expression, such as "Cheers!" in English, "Prost!" in German, or "Kanpai!" in Japanese.

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Toast (honor)":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Toast_(honor)]

title: macroich_(housamo)
body:
[[Tokyo Afterschool Summoners]] character.

Designed by [[Gozu farm]].

Transient from the world of Tir na Nog. He's a second year student at the private Bukuro Academy in Ikebukuro, Toshima Ward. He is part of the kendo team and a giant who wields a two-sword style in the underground fight ring. He either self-imposes or is imposed with the behavioral conduct of a military man who complies with others' wills. As a result of that, in the past there were many who relied on him for power, which also resulted in many toying with his determination. But over in Ikebukuro where Fergus's memories and experiences are suitable for him, he seems to be glorifying the life of a student. Perhaps of his role as a prophet, there are occasions where he glimpses at fragments of memories of times not set in the present. Every time the pain that springs back up from the difference between love and friendship reappears, he repeats his misunderstanding as he wonders if it is some kind of vision. He is a man whose constant catchphrase is "youth" and sees dreams of an adolescence he cannot return to. He holds good will towards those who honor a single choice like he does. He has a strange, frequent connection to the number seven, the number before eight. Since he's lost a part of the memory of the person known as Fergus and their role, he often just calls himself mac Roich.

h4. External Links

* "Housamo Wiki: Mac-roich":[https://housamo.wiki/MacRoich]

title: nobushi_(genshin_impact)
body:
[b]Nobushi[/b] (Japanese: 野伏) are enemies found in [i][[Genshin Impact]][/i].

They are wandering samurai who became bandits. They may sometimes collude with the Treasure Hoarders or Fatui to survive or earn money. Despite this and being collectively referred to with numerous names, they are decentralized.

title: hellshake_(racehorse)
body:
[[Real life]] Japanese Thoroughbred race[[horse]], romanized name rendered as "Hell Shake". Sired by [[Hokko Tarumae (racehorse)|]] and foaled by Pisa no Meissen.

The horse was named after the [[Poptepipic]] character [[Hellshake Yano]]. When Hellshake's owner, the Yamaguchi Stable, put out a recruitment notice for a jockey, they specifically asked for one named Yano, resulting in the hire of [[Yano Takayuki]]. As such, most art featuring Hellshake (and Yano) skews towards referencing Poptepipic.

h4. External links

* Anime News Network: "Pop Team Epic Namesake Racehorse Sprints to 1st Place":[https://www.animenewsnetwork.com/interest/2023-02-28/pop-team-epic-namesake-racehorse-sprints-to-1st-place/.195388]
* Pixpedia: "ヘルシェイク(競走馬)":[https://dic.pixiv.net/a/%E3%83%98%E3%83%AB%E3%82%B7%E3%82%A7%E3%82%A4%E3%82%AF%28%E7%AB%B6%E8%B5%B0%E9%A6%AC%29]

title: f-1_grenade_(soviet)
body:
The [b]F-1[/b] is a fragmentation [[grenade]] of [[Soviet]] origin, introduced in 1939 and first used in World War II. It is based on the French F1 grenade. Due to its shape and its common yellow-green color, it is nicknamed the [i]limonka[/i] (little lemon). It is also nicknamed [i]Efka[/i] (Эфка) for the letter F.

h1. See also
* [[List of Weapons]]
* [[RG-42]]
* [[RGD-33]]

h1. External links

title: the_red_shoes_(andersen)
body: "The Red Shoes" is a literary fairy tale by Danish poet and author Hans Christian Andersen first published in 1845, about a girl forced to dance continually in her red shoes. It has been adapted to various media including film, notably in 1948 as the basis for a British psychological drama of the same name.

title: sasuke_(ninja_warrior)
body:
[i][b]Sasuke[/b][/i] is a sports entertainment reality competition where a number of contestants (typically 100) traverse a four-stage obstacle course. Each obstacle is designed to tax either a contestant's agility, quickness in feet, or upper body strength. A false move in passing the obstacle would make them fall into the water below. This culminates in a final stage composed of a rope climb to the top of a high platform in a given time limit. The competition is typically run in Japan as at least a three-hour show. Edited/Shortened versions are aired outside Japan under the title [i]Ninja Warrior[/i] (hence this tag's qualifier and later officially the show's subtitle) and several localized versions outside Japan have since made, some using the [i]Ninja Warrior[/i] name (e.g. [i]American Ninja Warrior[/i] and [i]Ninja Warrior UK[/i] to name two of the best known).

Named after the character [[Sarutobi Sasuke]].

h4. External links:

h6. Oiriginal Japanese version:
* "Official website":[https://www.tbs.co.jp/sasuke_rising/]
* "SASUKE | Sasukepedia Wiki - Fandom":[https://sasukepedia.fandom.com/wiki/SASUKE]
* "Wikipedia: [i]Sasuke[/i] (TV series)":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sasuke_(TV_series)]

h6.  Some official sites of localized versions

title: qinshi_mingyue
body:
[b][i]The Legend of Qin[/i][/b] (Chinese: 秦时明月; pinyin: qín shí míng yuè), also [b][i]Qin's Moon[/i][/b], is a CG Chinese animated wuxia TV series. The story is based on novel of the same name by Taiwanese writer and entrepreneur Sayling Wen. It is China's first 3D animation, produced by Sparkly Key Animation Studio (Sparkly Key) in Hangzhou, Zhejiang. The series was first broadcast around Chinese New Year in 2007.

title: officer_flying_pov_(meme)
body:
Officer Flying POV, also known as Cop Flying POV, refers to a POV, fisheye, bodycam photo of a cop jumping at the camera, appearing like he is flying towards the viewer to arrest them. The image was allegedly AI-generated and first appeared on Reddit in early 2023. Continuing into the year, it became a notable reaction image and was paired with various captions that mostly outlined a scenario that would prompt someone's arrest.

https://knowyourmeme.com/memes/officer-flying-pov

YoRHa Attacker No.4, YoRHa android who partook in the Fourteenth Machine War, appears in the YoRHa stage play, the YoRHa 1.05 novella written by Eishima Jun, the Manga series YoRHa: Pearl Harbor Descent Record, and most recently the NieR: Automata Ver1.1a anime by A-1 Pictures.

Depiction varies across various media, though it is made clear in every media that she does not wear her combat goggles properly, she leaves one eye exposed.

title: transgender
body:
Danbooru is a visual tagging gallery, and it's impossible to tell from a picture what a character's thoughts are, so the current policy is to tag the character's biological sex for [[1boy]]/[[1girl]]/character count tags. 

For the act of gender transitioning, see [[gender transitioning]].

title: help:tag_aliases
body:
Tag aliases are used to fix a "canonical" version of a tag's name. This feature is used in a few different scenarios:

* Variant spellings, especially for character names: [[kyuubey]] → [[kyubey]].
* Synonyms: [[clavicle]] → [[collarbone]].
* Artists that have changed their preferred names.

When the antecedent tag (before the arrow) is added to an image, Danbooru automatically removes it and adds the consequent tag (after the arrow) in its place. The antecedent is otherwise treated as being identical to the consequent for searches and some other actions.

Tag aliases differ from [[help:tag_implications|implications]], where both tags remain on the image. In other words, aliases are for tags referring to the same thing, while implications are for situations where one tag describes a subset of the images belonging to another tag.

You can request that an alias be created by using the "bulk update request form":/bulk_update_requests/new.

h4. Chained aliases

h6. Given that A -> B alias exists

* If B -> C gets added
* Then the alias is updated to A -> C

h6. Given that B -> C alias exists

* A -> B aliases are rejected

title: russia
body:
A country located at the northern part of the Asia and eastern part of Europe. At 17,125,200 square kilometres (6,612,100 sq mi), it is the largest country in the world. Formerly, it was the core of the [[Soviet|Soviet Union]] from 1922 to 1991, and before that, the core of the [[Russian Empire]]. 

In 2022, President [[Vladimir Putin]] launched [[russo-ukrainian war|an invasion]] of neighboring country [[Ukraine]] to seek the "demilitarisation and denazification" of it.

h4. See also

* [[Russian Navy]]
* [[Spetsnaz]]
