title: help:artists
body:
h4. What are artists?

An artist in Danbooru represents the person who created a piece of art. Danbooru's artist database tracks extra information about artists, including the websites they use and alternate names they're known under.

h4. How do artist entries differ from tags?

For starters, artist entries list all websites or artist profiles that are associated with the artist. Danbooru uses these URLs to automatically identify the artist tag for new uploads, so it's very important to include this information.

Artists can also have multiple "other" names associated with them. Typically this includes the artist's Japanese name. Notes allow one to list other extraneous details.

Artist entries are also used to organize artists that are part of doujin circles. A circle is represented as an artist entry that has multiple group members.

h4. How do I search for artists?

Start at the "index":/artists. In addition to browsing through the entire artist list, you can also search for artist by name or by URL.

By default, Danbooru will search across names, other names, and group names using exact string matching. You can do wildcard searching with "*". For example, searching for "bol*" will return any artist whose name starts with "bol".

If you only want to search the name field, prefix your query with [i]name:[/i] like [i]name:john.[/i] [i]group:[/i] and [i]other:[/i] work similarly.

Suppose you know the artist's homepage, but can't figure out their name. Simply search for the URL (beginning with http) and Danbooru will return any associated artists.

h4. How do I create an artist?

First off, go "here":/artists/new. Second, [[howto:artist|search name and fill artist page]].

You'll see five fields. [b]Name[/b] is self-explanatory. [b]Other Names[/b] are for any miscellaneous names or identities the artist has, separated by commas. For example, you can place the artist's name in kanji or kana in this field. [b]Group[/b] is the name of the group or circle this artist belongs to. [b]Notes[/b] are for any extra tidbits of information you want to mention (this field is actually saved to the artist's matching wiki page on Danbooru).

The URLs field is a list of URLs associated with the artist, like their home page, their blog, and any servers that store the artist's images. Separate URLs with newlines or spaces.

h4. What is a banned artist?

Artists may request that all their works to be removed from the site. When this happens, the artist is marked as banned. New uploads by a banned artist will be taken down automatically.

See [[banned artist]] for the full list of banned artists.

h4. Are artists tied to tags?

No. If you create an artist-typed tag, a corresponding artist is not automatically created. If you create an artist but no corresponding tag, searching for posts by that artist won't return any results.

You can think of the artist database as separate from the tags database.

This is an intentional design decision. By keeping the two separated, users have far more freedom when it comes to creating aliases, groups, and edits.

h4. When I search for a URL, I get a bunch of unrelated results. What's going on?

Short answer: this is just a side-effect of the way Danbooru searches URLs. Multiple results typically mean Danbooru couldn't find the artist.

Long answer: when you're searching for a URL, typically it's a URL to an image on the artist's site. If this is a new image, querying this will obviously return no results.

So what Danbooru does is progressively chop off directories from the URL. http://site.com/a/b/c.jpg becomes http://site.com/a/b becomes http://site.com/a becomes http://site.com. It keeps doing this until a match is found. Danbooru does this more than once because there are cases where the URL is nested by date, like in http://site.com/2007/06/05/image.jpg. Usually this algorithm works very well, provided the artist has an entry in the database.

If they do not, then the algorithm is probably going to cut the URL down to just the domain, e.g. http://geocities.co.jp. When this happens, you'll sometimes get every artist hosted on that domain.

Why not just dump all the results if you get more than one? Well, there are a few cases when multiple artists validly map to the same domain. Usually the domain is just being used to host files or something.

h4. Is there an API?

Yes. The artist controller uses the same interface as the rest of Danbooru. See the [[help:api|API documentation]] for details.

h4. See also

* Using Pixiv: [[howto:pixiv]]

title: help:autotags
body:
These tags are automatically added by the site. Most of these tags cannot be manually added or removed.

h4. Tags

h6. Resolution
* [[lowres]]: Both width and height are <= 500.
* [[highres]]: Either width is >= 1600 or height is >= 1200.
* [[absurdres]]: Either width is >= 3200 or height is >= 2400.
* [[incredibly absurdres]]: Either dimension is >= 10000.
* [[wide image]]: Image is at least 4x wider than it is tall, and the width is >= 1024.
* [[tall image]]: Image is at least 4x taller than it is wide, and the height is >= 1024.

h6. File type
* [[animated gif]]: A GIF that has 2 or more frames.
* [[animated png]]: A valid APNG file.
* [[flash]]: A Flash animation or game.
* [[video]]: A video in WebM or MP4 format.
* [[ugoira]]: An animation in the ugoira format used by Pixiv.
* [[exif rotation]]: An image with an EXIF flag set to rotate it.
* [[non-repeating animation]]: An [[animated]] image that loops under 10 times.
* [[greyscale]]: An image saved in the greyscale color space. Unreliable due to artists saving greyscale images in others color spaces.

h6. Audio

* [[sound]]: A [[video]] with audible sound (any sound louder than -70 dB).

h6. Sources

* [[non-web source]]: If the post contains a source that is not an http(s) link.
* [[bad link]]: If the post's source is recognized by Danbooru as a direct image URL rather than a link to a post.
* [[bad source]]: If the post's source is recognized by Danbooru but does not come from an image or post URL.

h6. Wildcard Implications

* [[cosplay]]: If the post is tagged with a "*_(cosplay)":/tags?search[name_matches]=*_(cosplay)&search[order]=count tag, the character and [[cosplay]] tags are added as well. For example, tagging [[hatsune miku (cosplay)]] automatically tags [[hatsune miku]] and [[cosplay]].
* [[school uniform]]: If the post is tagged with a "*_school_uniform":/tags?search[name_matches]=*_school_uniform&search[order]=count tag, the [[school uniform]] tag is added as well.
* [[meme]]: If the post is tagged with a "*_(meme)":/tags?search[name_matches]=*_(meme)&search[order]=count tag, the [[meme]] tag is added as well.

h4. Notes

* [[Wide image]] and [[tall image]] can be added and removed from posts that don't meet the criteria listed above, but they cannot be removed from posts that do.
* [[Animated]] and [[sound]] can only be added manually to [[Flash]] posts.
* [[Bad link]] and [[bad source]] are only automatically managed on sites that Danbooru supports. For other sites, they can be added or removed at will.
* [[Tagme]] is automatically added to posts with no non-auto tags, and automatically removed when a post has 30 tags. It can be added or removed at will otherwise.

title: about:upload_limits
body:
Upload limits are used, along with the [[about:mod queue|moderation system]], to prevent uploaders from flooding the site with too many low-quality images. You can see your current upload limit on your "profile page":[/profile] or on the "upload page":[/uploads/new].

Your upload limit controls how many {{status:pending}} or {{status:appealed}} posts you can have in the [[about:mod queue|moderation queue]] at once. For example, if you have an upload limit of 15, then you can have 15 {{status:pending}} posts at once. When you reach your limit, you can't upload more until your existing uploads are either approved or deleted.

New uploaders should be careful about uploading too many posts at once. If you run out of upload slots, you may have to wait up to 3 days for your posts to be deleted before you can upload again.

h4. Rules

Here's how the system works:

* Each {{status:pending}} post takes up one upload slot.
* Each {{status:appealed}} post takes up three upload slots.
* If any of your uploads are manually deleted in under three days ({{status:deleted age:<3d}}), they take up five upload slots.
* Slots are freed when uploads are approved, or after three days if they are not approved.
* You start out with 15 upload slots and can have between 5 and 40 upload slots.
* You gain and lose slots based on approvals and deletions:
** You lose a slot for every 3 deletions.
** You gain a slot for every N approved uploads, where N depends on how many slots you already have:
*** If you have 15 slots or less, then you gain a slot for every 10 approved uploads.
*** If you have more than 15 slots, then you need 10 approvals, plus 2 more per upload slot over 15.

For example, if you have 15 upload slots, then you need 10 approvals for the next slot. If you have 16 slots, then you need 12 approvals. If you have 17 slots, you need 14 approvals, and so on. The number of approvals you need goes up by 2 every level.

At the maximum level you can have 40 upload slots. To reach this level you will need at least 900 approved uploads and an average deletion ratio of less than 5%.

h4. Contributors

Contributor-level users and above ([[help:users]]) have no upload limit. You may be granted this privilege by consistently uploading high-quality posts while maintaining a low deletion ratio. The general criteria for Contributor level is having 1000 uploads and having a recent deletion ratio of around 5% or lower, though users with very few deleted posts might be promoted at lower thresholds.

h4. See also

* [[about:mod queue]]
* topic #16499

title: howto:pawoo
body:
"Pawoo":https://pawoo.net/ is an instance of "Mastodon":https://github.com/tootsuite/mastodon run by [[Pixiv]] Inc. It is best known as an alternative to [[Twitter]] for posting NSFW art, especially [[loli]], [[shota]], and [[toddlercon]].

On pawoo (and other instances of Mastodon), 'tweets' are referred to as 'toots', 'likes' are referred to as 'favorites' and 'retweets' are referred to as 'boosts'.

This page will describe how to sign up and upload from Pawoo, in addition to how to handle new artist entries in the case an entry doesn't already exist for the artist you're uploading a work from.

h4. Word of caution

Uploading from pawoo is unadvised for a few reasons:

* All jpg images are resampled (albeit at a lower rate than Twitter)
* All images are currently configured to be resized to a maximum of 1280x1280, much smaller than what Twitter allows.

You should always look for a better image source off another site such as pixiv or nicoseiga if it is available ([[help:image source]]).

h4. Signing up

Pawoo will not allow you to view links to the timeline if you do not have an account. That includes links like these:

* https://pawoo.net/web/accounts/8525
* https://pawoo.net/web/statuses/33721

The interface now has an English interface that also allows you to sign up with your pixiv account, so signing up should be fairly straightforward.

h4. Uploading

[b]1.[/b] Upload with the "danbooru bookmarklet":[/static/bookmarklet], or paste in the toot URL of the work you wish to upload in the upload page. This way, you don't have to upload the image from your computer. If you wish to upload multiple images, use the batch bookmarklet. The link to a toot should look something like this:

* https://pawoo.net/@maaya/33721

It's important to note that the HTML URL to the toot is much more preferred than that of the direct image URL to the tweet for various reasons. Artist information and commentary, for example, are readily available to pull from the image source if the tweet has not been taken down yet.

The upload page will [b]NOT[/b] always correct your source to the HTML link for you. Remember to correct it yourself when it so happens.

[b]2.[/b] Use the artist tag detected under [b]Related Tags[/b], if there is one. If there is none, you may refer to the rest of this article on how to choose an artist name and make an entry for them, or correct their artist entry if they have changed their twitter handle.

[b]3.[/b] Remember to [[howto:tag|tag]] the rest of your upload and follow the rest of the procedures under [[help:upload]]. If the source is not fixed after your upload has completed, you will have to fix it yourself.

h4. Artist entries

Most pawoo users will have a pixiv account, usually listed somewhere in their profile. If not that, they they may also have a twitter account to reference. In cases like these, see [[howto:pixiv]] or [[howto:twitter]]. Remember to add new Pawoo account URLs to their artist entries if they exist.

If none can be found, see [[howto:artist]] for how to romanize their name and add a new artist entry for them.

h4. See also

* topic #13941
* [[help:pawoo api|Pawoo API]]
* {{source:https://pawoo.net/}}
* {{source:https://img.pawoo.net/}} -- this should have no matches.
* {{source:https://pawoo.net/media/}} -- neither should this.

h4. External links

* "pawoo.net Source Code":https://github.com/pixiv/mastodon

title: help:favorites
body:
You can save individual [[help:posts|posts]] to a personal list of favorites. You need an [[help:users|account]] in order to use this feature, and you must [b]have JavaScript enabled[/b] in your browser.

h4. Adding and removing favorites

To add a post to your favorites, press the "f" key, or click on the [b]Favorite[/b] link under the [b]Options[/b] heading in the sidebar. Alternatively, you can use [[help:posts|Favorite mode]] from the "main listing":/posts.

To remove a post from your favorites, press the "shift+f" keys, or click on the [b]Unfavorite[/b] link under the [b]Options[/b] heading in the sidebar. Alternatively, you can use [[help:posts|Unfavorite mode]] from the "main listing":/posts.

h4. Viewing favorites

You can view your favorites by clicking on [b]Favorites[/b] from the "main listing":/posts, by searching for {{fav:your_user_name}}, or by going to [b]My Account[/b], then [b]Favorites[/b].

There are two different orders in which you can view favorites, each one with a different metatag:

* {{fav:your_user_name}} – find all posts in your favorites list, in the order they were uploaded.

* {{ordfav:your_user_name}} – find all posts in your favorites list, in the order you favorited them.

h4. Maximum numbers of favorites

There is a limit to the number of favorites you can have, depending on your account level. If you have a regular member account, the limit is 10,000 favorites. If you have a Gold account, it is 20,000 favorites. If you have a Platinum or above account, there is no limit to your favorites. More information on upgrading your account can be found on "this page":/user_upgrades/new.

h4. Favorites are not private by default

Your list of favorites is publicly viewable by other users by default. You can change it so only you can see your favorites by enabling privacy mode. See [[help:privacy mode]]

title: help:imagesize
body:
There are numerous ways in which you can search posts by resolution and filesize.

h4. Resolution

* [[lowres]] - Both width and height are <= 500.
* [[highres]] - Either width is >= 1600 or height is >= 1200.
* [[absurdres]] - Either width is >= 3200 or height is >= 2400.
* [[incredibly absurdres]] - Either dimension is >= 10000.
* [[wide image]] - Image is at least 4x wider than it is tall, and the width is >= 1024.
* [[tall image]] - Image is at least 4x taller than it is wide, and the height is >= 1024.
* [code]width:[/code] - Search posts by image width.
* [code]height:[/code] - Search posts by image height.
* [code]mpixels:[/code] - Search posts by number of pixels.
* [code]ratio:[/code] - Search posts by width:height ratio.

h4. Filesize

* [code]filesize:[/code] Search posts by file size.

h4. Example searches using metatags

{{width:100}}
Search for posts with a width of 100 pixels.

{{height:100}}
Search for posts with a height of 100 pixels.

{{mpixels:5..}}
Search for posts with 5 million pixels or greater.

{{ratio:16:9}}
Search for posts with a width:height ratio of 16:9.

{{filesize:200kb..1.5m}}
Search for posts with a filesize between 200 kilobytes and 1.5 megabytes.

[quote]
See [[help:number_syntax|Number Syntax]] for an explanation of the number syntax used in the metatags.
[/quote]

h4. See also

* [[Help:Autotags]]: A list of all automatic tags.
* [[Help:Cheatsheet]]: A complete list of tags and metatags.
* [[Help:Number syntax]]: Information on searching using numbers.

title: help:tag_implications
body:
Tag implications are used when all images belonging to one tag should also be tagged with another, broader tag. For example, [[4koma]] implies [[comic]], and [[fate/stay_night]] implies [[fate_(series)]]. Since implications are applied automatically, they are not used in situations where one tag is only commonly, but not always, tagged with another.

For the most part, implications are only used when both tags are of the same type (general, copyright, character, or artist). Character tags do not imply their respective copyrights, as the maintenance burden for such a system would be too high and of questionable benefit (see topic #10624).

When two tags refer to exactly the same concept, an [[help:tag_aliases|alias]] should be created instead.

You can request that an implication be created using the "bulk update request form":/bulk_update_requests/new.

title: howto:upload
body: This page has been moved to [[help:upload]].

title: howto:artstation
body:
ArtStation is an online platform for artists to upload and showcase their work.

This page will describe how to upload from ArtStation, in addition to how to handle new artist entries in the case an entry doesn't already exist for the artist you're uploading a work from.

h4. Uploading

The uploading process has been simplified for ArtStation. Upload with the "danbooru bookmarklet":[/static/bookmarklet], or paste in the URL of the work you wish to upload in the upload page. This way, you don't have to upload the image from your computer and risk it being an [[image sample]]. If you wish to upload a project with multiple images, the batch bookmarklet will make this much easier.

If after uploading the source is a direct image URL or blank, it should be changed to the HTML URL of the work. There are two types of HTML URL pages for projects on ArtStation. The www version represents the main site, in addition to pages based on a custom domain name for the artist. On the custom domain name gallery, the artist can make some images available not on the www gallery. Either URL should technically work and detect artist names, however the artist subdomain is able to be changed. Below is an example of a preferred source:

[code]
https://www.artstation.com/artwork/EJ6Jn
[/code]

You can observe that the alternative URL structure is simply borrowed from the other by comparing them, as shown below by the same project on the different pages.

[code]
https://deel.artstation.com/projects/EJ6Jn
https://www.artstation.com/artwork/EJ6Jn
[/code]

Use the artist tag detected under [b]Related Tags[/b], if there is one. If there is none, you may refer to the rest of this article on how to choose an artist name and make an entry for them.

Remember to [[howto:tag|tag]] the rest of your upload and follow the rest of the procedures under [[help:upload]].

h4. Artist naming and entry

If there are no other active accounts on which an artist posts, the name listed in their profile will usually be sufficient for their artist name. If their ArtStation account has been found linked from one their other accounts such as DeviantArt or Pixiv than their ArtStation URLs (seen below) should be appended to their existing artist entry. See "Artist tagging help":/forum_topics/8199 thread if you are unsure or think an artist name should be changed.

There are two URLs for an ArtStation artist that should be included in their artist entry list of URLs. One starts with www and the other is a customization subdomain. Unlike Pixiv however direct links to images should not be included. Below is an example for one artist:
* https://www.artstation.com/geosiador
* https://geosiador.artstation.com/

[b]Note[/b]: Artists on ArtStation are able to edit their usernames on the site. When this happens both the above URLs will change and should subsequently be added to their artist entry, however the old ones should not be removed.

Sometimes an artists other accounts may be listed in the About subheading on their ArtStation profile. This could help find an existing artist entry or should be appended to the artist's URL list.

h4. Legacy "/original/" files
At its launch, ArtStation had higher-resolution or quality version of images sometimes available. This allowed users to sometimes upload much higher quality versions of images form the source. Many images uploaded prior to suspension of this file thankfully remain on Danbooru as legacy content from that time, despite no longer being available from ArtStation. See below for the legacy instructions on uploading these images, which was later automated by the recommended bookmarklet:

[expand]
ArtStation has reduced-size versions of its images known as [[artstation sample]]s, none of which should be uploaded here.

To find the full image URL, you must manually alter part of the image URL (typically [b]/large/[/b] or [b]/4k/[/b]) to [b]/original/[/b]. If the [b]/original/[/b] returns a [b]file not found[/b] error, then the [b]/4k/[/b] image is accepted as the original. Some small images have similar [b]/large/[/b] and [b]/4k/[/b] version, because check biggest quality.

URLs with different resolution:

[quote]
Original [tn](not always exist)[/tn]: https://cdnb.artstation.com/p/assets/images/images/028/861/423/original/acorecell-cell-qn-1.jpg
Sample large resolution: https://cdnb.artstation.com/p/assets/images/images/028/861/423/large/acorecell-cell-qn-1.jpg
Sample 4K resolution: https://cdnb.artstation.com/p/assets/images/images/028/861/423/4k/acorecell-cell-qn-1.jpg
[/quote][/expand]

h4. See also

* [[artstation sample]]
* [[bad artstation id]]
* [[md5 mismatch]]

title: howto:drawcrowd
body:
Drawcrowd [tn](dead/closed)[/tn] is an online platform for artists to upload and showcase their work. It is one of the newest sources of images for Danbooru.

This page will describe how to upload from Drawcrowd, in addition to how to handle new artist entries in the case an entry doesn't already exist for the artist you're uploading a work from.

[b]As Drawcrowd is still new, it is important to read these instructions carefully.[/b] One of the peculiar intricacies about Drawcrowd is that the download button is misleading and does not download the actual, full and original image. The original images are kept hidden to mitigate bandwidth costs.

h4. Uploading

Here's the ideal procedure when uploading from Drawcrowd.
Drawcrowd has reduced-size versions of its images known as [[drawcrowd sample]]s, none of which should be uploaded here.

To find the full image URL, you must manually alter part of the image URL (typically [b]/large/[/b]) to [b]/original/[/b]. If the [b]/original/[/b] returns a [b]file not found[/b] error, then the [b]/large/[/b] image is accepted as the original.

[b]2.[/b] Change the source from the direct image URL to the HTML URL of the work.  It should look like the following:

[quote]
[nodtext]https://drawcrowd.com/projects/mtq1mtg5ltctmjatndq[/nodtext]
[/quote]

[b]3.[/b] Use the artist tag detected under [b]Related Tags[/b], if there is one. If there is none, you may refer to the rest of this article on how to choose an artist name and make an entry for them.

[b]4.[/b] Remember to [[howto:tag|tag]] the rest of your upload and follow the rest of the procedures under [[help:upload]].

h4. Artist naming and entry

If there are no other active accounts on which an artist posts, the name listed in their profile will usually be sufficient for their artist name. If their Drawcrowd account has been found linked from one their other accounts such as DeviantArt or Pixiv than their ArtStation URLs (seen below) should be appended to their existing artist entry. See "Artist tagging help":/forum_topics/8199 thread if you are unsure or think an artist name should be changed.

There is one URL for a Drawcrowd artist that should be included in their artist entry list of URLs. Below is an example for one artist:

* [nodtext]https://drawcrowd.com/liberea[/nodtext]

Sometimes an artists other accounts may be listed in the About subheading on their Drawcrowd profile. This could help find an existing artist entry or should be appended to the artist's URL list.

h4. See also

* [[drawcrowd sample]]
* [[bad drawcrowd id]]
* [[md5 mismatch]]

title: howto:nijie
body:
Nijie is a website where a number of Japanese artists upload their works. It has a primary focus on sexually suggestive and explicit works. In addition to [[pixiv]] and [[niconico|nicoseiga]], it is another major source of images on Danbooru.

This page will describe how to upload from nijie, in addition to how to handle new artist entries in the case an entry doesn't already exist for the artist you're uploading a work from.

h4. Uploading

Here's the ideal procedure when uploading from Nijie.

[b]1.[/b] Upload with the "danbooru bookmarklet":[/static/bookmarklet], or paste in the URL of the work you wish to upload in the upload page. Luckily, Nijie does not actually have samples in case you decide not to go this route, but it is still highly recommended. The bookmarklet works from both [code]view.php[/code] and [code]view_popup.php[/code] pages. If you wish to upload multiple images, use the batch bookmarklet.

[b]2.[/b] Use the artist tag detected under [b]Related Tags[/b], if there is one. If there is none, you may refer to the rest of this article on how to choose an artist name and make an entry for them.

[b]3.[/b] Remember to [[howto:tag|tag]] the rest of your upload and follow the rest of the procedures under [[help:upload]].

h4. Artist naming

Rule of thumb is: Make a [b]simple, readable, and memorizable[/b] tag.

The first choice is to use the artist's real name if you can find it on any websites or blogs listed on their nijie profile. See [[howto:artist]] for advice on finding the artist's name on their website.

Many artists also have [[pixiv]] accounts in addition to their Nijie account. Refer to [[howto:pixiv]] for more information in the case you find one.

Once you have a name, [[howto:romanize|romanize it]]. Name kanji often have several different readings, so it's best to use any available indicators (such as their twitter handle) on how to read the name. If you don't know how to read this name or are unsure of the correct reading, post in topic #8199 to ask for help.

Note that Nijie nicknames are not necessarily unique. If it is too generic ("Ken", "Daisuke", "Youko", etc.), add a qualifier to make it unique. Good choices for qualifiers include:

* The artist's circle name
** e.g. [[gurande_(g-size)]]
* The artist's twitter handle
** e.g. [[oyamada_(pi0v0jg)]]
* If nothing else exists, their nijie ID
** This is a very rare case, and should be avoided.

h5. Things to note

* [b]Do not[/b] use non-ASCII characters for the artist's name, even if they look like ASCII letters--Ｒｙｕ is not the same as Ryu. Save that for the "Other names" field.
* [b]Do not[/b] use "_(nijie)" or "_(artist)" as the qualifier. There are probably a dozen Nijie artists named Sakura or Miki, so those qualifiers are simply not effective.
* [b]Try not to[/b] make a hard to read name like [[ken_(oooxvbgj)]].

h4. Artist entries

To create or edit an artist entry, click the '?' next to the artist tag in the tag list. In the artist entry, add:

h6. Other Names
* The artist's Nijie nickname (found under their profile picture).
* Any other account names, Twitter handles, or nicknames on other sites the artist lists in their profile.

h6. URLs
* The Nijie profile URL: http://nijie.info/members.php?id=10543
* URLs of any other websites the artist lists in their Nijie profile.

See the last section of [[howto:artist]] for more information about artist entries.

h4. See also

* [[bad nijie id]]
* [[md5 mismatch]]

title: howto:tumblr
body:
[[Tumblr]] is a social networking website that allows users to post multimedia and other content to a short blog. It is a popular source of images for Danbooru.

This page will describe how to upload from Tumblr, in addition to how to handle new artist entries in the case an entry doesn't already exist for the artist you're uploading a work from.

h4. Uploading

Uploading using either the bookmarklet or upload page will automatically retrieve the best image available. This way, you don't have to upload the image from your computer and risk it being an [[image sample]]. For more technical details, you may expand the following:

[expand]
Tumblr has reduced-size versions of its images known as [[tumblr sample]]s, none of which should be uploaded here. These samples may carry one of multiple available file name suffixes: 

* [code]_75sq[/code] (sample; thumbnail)
* [code]_100[/code] (sample; thumbnail)
* [code]_250[/code] (sample)
* [code]_400[/code] (sample)
* [code]_500[/code] (sample; sometimes original, see forum #132817)
* [code]_500h[/code] (sample; height-bounded)
* [code]_540[/code] (sample)
* [code]_640[/code] (sample)
* [code]_1280[/code] (sample; sometimes original)

Where the original usually ends with:

* [code]_raw[/code]

In addition to these, any image that matches the following query is also a sample [i]unless[/i] it has a [b]r*[/b] (r1, r2, etc.) in the filename:

* {{source:*tumblr.com/ md5_mismatch downscaled status:active}}

post #2568503 is not a sample, for example (note the [b]r2[/b]).
[/expand]

h5. Using the bookmarklet

[b]This method is highly recommended![/b]

[b]1.[/b] Upload with the "danbooru bookmarklet":[/static/bookmarklet], or paste in the URL of the work you wish to upload in the upload page. If you wish to upload multiple images, use the batch bookmarklet.

[b]2.[/b] Use the artist tag detected under [b]Related Tags[/b], if there is one. If there is none, you may refer to the rest of this article on how to choose an artist name and make an entry for them.

[b]3.[/b] Remember to [[howto:tag|tag]] the rest of your upload and follow the rest of the procedures under [[help:upload]]. If your source link isn't fixed, you should remember to fix that also.

h5. Using the "uploads":/uploads/new page

[b]1.[/b] Copy the image URL into the [b]Source[/b] box. The upload page will automatically retrieve the largest size available (typically [code]_raw[/code]), so you won't need to change it unless you wish to be extra careful. Just like above, the image URL for "this post":[http://r-ringo00001.tumblr.com/post/154203047608] is "this":[https://68.media.tumblr.com/8818848735da2f77be8669c45e8d3bae/tumblr_ohva67iieD1tq4vrto2_r2_1280.jpg].

[b]2.[/b] Tag your post and upload it.

[b]3.[/b] Since the upload page will not correct the source for you as there is no referrer, you must remember to correct it yourself. Just like above, the source should point to the tumblr post and look something like "this":[http://r-ringo00001.tumblr.com/post/154203047608].

h4. Artist naming

Before creating a new artist, search for an existing artist entry using the following steps:

[b]1.[/b]. Search for the artist Tumblr homepage URL using the "Danbooru Artists page":[/artists]. It should look something like this:

* http://r-ringo00001.tumblr.com/

[b]2.[/b] Using the same method, search for any other URL from the artist's Tumblr profile if available, or use "SauceNAO":[http://saucenao.com/] or "IQDB":[http://danbooru.iqdb.org/] to see if any of artist's images turn up any hits for Danbooru. You may find there already exists an entry for the artist. If so, then add the artist's Tumblr URL to their artist entry and stop here. If not, follow the next step.

[b]3.[/b] Create a "new artist entry":[/artists/new].

* See [[Howto:Artist]] for more information.
* Ask for help in topic #8199 if you are unsure.

h4. See also

* [[tumblr sample]]
* [[bad tumblr id]]
* [[md5 mismatch]]

title: howto:tinami
body:
[[Tinami]] is a Japanese online community for artists. It is a minor source of images for Danbooru.

This page will describe how to upload from tinami, in addition to how to handle new artist entries in the case an entry doesn't already exist for the artist you're uploading a work from.

h4. Uploading

[b]Uploading using the "danbooru bookmarklet":/static/bookmarklet is [u]currently unavailable[/u] for Tinami.[/b]

Additionally, [b]uploading using the image URL on the "uploads page":[/uploads/new] [u]will not work either[/u].[/b] This is due to an issue with Tinami that requires the HTTP Referer header to be from the Tinami domain. (See Issue #2818)

Therefore, uploading from Tinami requires downloading the image to your local machine, then uploading it using the file function from the [b]uploads page[/b].

After uploading the image, edit the source so that it points to the original post page and not the image link (ex: [b][nodtext]http://www.tinami.com/view/1234[/nodtext][/b]).  This will make it easier to find the artist and the original post that picture came from.

h4. Artist naming

Before creating a new artist, search for an existing artist entry using the following steps:

1. Search for the artist Tinami profile URL (ex: [b][nodtext]http://www.tinami.com/creator/profile/1234[/nodtext][/b]) from the "Danbooru Artists page":[/artists].

2. Search for any other URL from the artist's Tinami profile using the method in [b]#1[/b] above.

3. Use "SauceNAO":[http://saucenao.com/] or "IQDB":[http://danbooru.iqdb.org/] to see if any of artist's thumbnail images turn up any hits for Danbooru. [tn][b]Note: [/b]Thumnail images do not have the same restrictions as regular image links, which is why this works[/tn]
* See [[Help:Image Source]] for more help on reverse-image search engines.
* Use thumbnail images from the artists gallery and not their profile, as the profile thumbnails get cropped.
** [b]This:[/b] [nodtext]http://www.tinami.com/search/list?prof_id=1234[/nodtext]
** [b]Not this:[/b] [nodtext]http://www.tinami.com/creator/profile/1234[/nodtext]

4. Create a "new artist entry":[/artists/new].

* See [[Howto:Artist]] for more information.
* Ask for help in topic #8199 if you are unsure.

h4. See also

* [[tinami sample]]
* [[bad tinami id]]
* [[md5 mismatch]]

title: howto:ehentai
body:
"e-Hentai":http://e-hentai.org is a website that mainly hosts scans and digital versions of comics, artbooks, and doujinshis.
 
This page will describe how to upload from e-Hentai.

h4. Sourcing

The ideal procedure when uploading from e-Hentai is as follows.
 
1. [b]Under no circumstances is it recommended to upload from e-Hentai using image URLs.[/b] e-Hentai image URLs are extremely finicky, and trying to upload from e-Hentai using an image URL greatly increases your chances of uploading an [[e-hentai sample]].
 
2. Instead, download the image using the "Download original XXXX x YYYY X.XX MB source" button at the bottom of an image page, and then upload the file to Danbooru from your computer.
 
3. On the upload page, you can input the URL of the page containing the image, which should look as follows:

[quote]
https://e-hentai.org/s/4fbd8a7e43/1132165-7
[/quote]
 
4. Do not use gallery URLs as sources. Use gallery URLs in pool descriptions when pooling posts from a comic, artbook, or doujinshi uploaded from e-Hentai. Gallery URLs should look as follows:

[quote]
https://e-hentai.org/g/1132165/6a659287cf/
[/quote]

h4. Pooling

If you upload most or all of a comic, artbook, or doujinshi from e-Hentai, you should group your uploads into a pool. Your pool description should include the original name of the comic/artbook/doujinshi, a link to the corresponding e-Hentai gallery, and a short description of the material. Read [[help:pools]] for more info.

h4. See also

* [[e-hentai sample]]
* [[exhentai]]
* [[nhentai]]

title: howto:deviantart
body:
[[deviantart|DeviantArt]] is a website where most Western artists upload their work. It serves as another major source of images on Danbooru.

This page will describe how to upload from DeviantArt, in addition to how to handle new artist entries in the case an entry doesn't already exist for the artist you're uploading a work from.

h4. Uploading

Here's the ideal procedure when uploading a DeviantArt artist:

[b]1.[/b] Upload with the "danbooru bookmarklet":[/static/bookmarklet], or paste in the URL of the work you wish to upload in the upload page. This way, you don't have to upload the image from your computer and risk it being an [[image sample]]. For more technical details, you may expand the following:

[expand]
Upload from DeviantArt (not from your computer) with the [b]full image URL[/b] if possible. On the right side, there should be a link to the URL labeled "Download". If it's not there, zoom into the picture as much as possible and copy the image URL from there. 

Since Danbooru supports direct linking to the image URL, the source URL should look like one of the following:

[quote]
http[i]:[/i]//[b]orig[/b]10.deviantart.net/b1f7/f/2015/169/1/b/1b095k69ceedwac54177e18132g8a084-d8xbdx0.jpg
http[i]:[/i]//[b]orig[/b]09.deviantart.net/cb07/f/2015/172/f/1/k_by_sampleartist-d4kso7f.png
[/quote]

Or if the original source URL cannot be accessed for whatever reason (that is, when the download button will not be present):

[quote]
http[i]:[/i]//[b]img[/b]14.deviantart.net/2d53/i/2015/156/a/c/___sample_work___by_sampleartist-d8w7vhm.jpg
[/quote]

DeviantArt has reduced-size versions of its images known as [[deviantart sample]]s, none of which should be uploaded here. Your source URL should not look like these:

[quote]
http[i]:[/i]//[b]pre[/b]03.deviantart.net/31ed/th/pre/f/2015/172/f/1/k_by_sampleartist-djy6akj.png
http[i]:[/i]//[b]pre[/b]07.deviantart.net/1a1f/th/pre/f/2015/169/1/b/1b095069ceedfacfdty177e18132b8a084-d4dudx0.jpg
[/quote]

[/expand]

[b]2.[/b] Use the artist tag detected by Danbooru under Related Tags, if there is one. If not, follow the rest of this howto to create a new artist tag.

* Do a [[help:cheatsheet|source:*username* search]] for the DeviantArt username. The username is usually found in image source URL. For example, search {{source:*shirononochiko*}} if the source URL is http[i]:[/i]//orig00.deviantart.net/e1d7/f/2013/096/7/2/nonexistent_work_by_[b]shirononochiko[/b]-gj83sbo8.png.
* If you find any posts and they already have an artist tag, use that tag. You will need to update the artist entry so that Danbooru will automatically detect the artist tag for future uploads. See [b]Artist Entries[/b] to learn how to do this.
* If this search didn't turn up any posts, or you find posts but they don't have an artist tag, then you will have to make a new artist tag yourself. Edit the post and add [b]artist:artist_name[/b] to the tags. See [b]Artist Naming[/b] for advice on choosing a name. After making a new artist tag, you will also have to create an artist entry. See [b]Artist Entries[/b] to learn how to do this.

h4. Artist Naming

The first choice is to use the artist's full real name, if you can find it. On the main profile under the artist's username, there should be a section that shows the artist's real name, gender, and location. The name should have both a first and a last name. If it's in non-English letters, follow Danbooru's [[howto:romanize|romanization guidelines]]. Otherwise, check any personal websites or blogs they may list in their DeviantArt profile. See [[howto:artist]] for advice on finding the artist's name on their website.

The second choice is their DeviantArt username.

h4. Artist Entries

After creating a new artist tag, click the '?' next to the artist tag in the tag list to create a new artist entry. In the artist entry add:

h6. Other Names
* Any other account names, Twitter handles, or nicknames on other sites the artist lists in their profile.

h6. URLs
* The DeviantArt profile URL: [b]h[/b][b]ttp://sampleartist.deviantart.com/[/b]
* URLs of any other websites the artist lists in their DeviantArt profile.

See the last section of [[howto:artist]] for more information about artist entries.

h4. See also

* [[deviantart sample]]
* [[bad deviantart id]]
* [[md5 mismatch]]

title: izumi_sagiri
body:
[[eromanga_sensei|Eromanga-sensei]] character. The titular artist making illustrations for a light novel series made by her older stepbrother, [[izumi_masamune|Masamune]]. Sagiri's (Eromanga-sensei) illustrations are drawn by [[tiv]] for the anime.

She has [[grey hair|grey]] or [[aqua hair|aqua]] [[low-tied long hair]] fitted with [[pink bow|pink]] [[hair bow]]s and [[blue eyes|blue]] or [[aqua eyes]]. Often seen in her [[pajamas]] or a blue [[jacket]], accompanied with a [[headset]], [[stylus]] and [[drawing_tablet|tablet]].

title: howto:comment
body:
Commenting is one of the major ways to communicate in the Danbooru community. 

h4. Comment formatting

See [[help:dtext]] for help with formatting comments.

h4. Rules

See [[help:community rules]].

title: help:tag_subscriptions
body:
h4. Warning: This feature was "discontinued":[/forum_topics/13612] on February 1, 2017. Its functionality has been replaced by "saved searches":[/wiki_pages/83158].

With a [[help:users|Gold account]] you can subscribe to a group of tag searches. A background process runs once per day to refresh your tag subscriptions providing you a listing of the 200 most recent posts matching your searches. You can think of a tag subscription as a bookmark to a tag search, but coupled with the full power of Danbooru's tag query engine.

You can create up to five groups and each group can have up to 20 searches. Any search that works in the post listing will work with tag subscriptions, which means any metatag will work. You can even create tag subscriptions based on other people's tag subscriptions.

You can search your own tag subscriptions using the sub: metatag from the main post listing. To search for albert's tag subscriptions for example, search for [i]sub:albert[/i]. To search albert's touhou tag subscription group, you can search for [i]sub:albert:touhou[/i]. Because the posts are rendered through the main listing, you can also view the Atom feed, the Piclens feed, and all API calls will work as expected. And like any other metatag, you can combine it with other tags (to a degree).

Each search should go on a separate line. So if you put two tags on the same line, it will only match posts with both those tags. But if you put two tags on separate lines, it will match posts with either of the two tags.

To edit your tag subscriptions, visit your "tag subscriptions":/tag_subscriptions page.

title: help:tag_scripts
body:
Tag scripts allow you to quickly add and remove tags to posts by clicking on their thumbnails. You can add tags, remove tags, change ratings, and more. Only Gold-level and above users can use tag scripts.

To start tag scripting, first change the Mode dropdown box (beneath the Search box) to "Tag script" mode. Type the tag(s) you want to add or remove in the text field that appears. After that, simply click on each post thumbnail you want to apply the tags to.

You can have up to 10 tag scripts at once. To change between them, use the number keys (be sure to deselect the tag script input box first). A notification will be displayed confirming which tag script is active. 

The best way to illustrate how tag scripts work is through examples:

* [b]cat[/b] would add the [[cat]] tag to the post.
* [b]cat dog[/b] would add both the [[cat]] and [[dog]] tags.
* [b]-cat -dog[/b] would remove the cat and dog tags.
* [b]cat -dog[/b] would add the cat tag and remove the dog tag.
* [b]rating:e[/b] would change the post's rating to explicit.
* [b]pool:Disgustingly_Adorable[/b] would add the post to the Disgustingly Adorable pool.
* [b]fav:me[/b] would favorite the post.
* [b]-fav:me[/b] would unfavorite the post.

See [[help:cheatsheet]] for a list of other metatags you can use with tag scripts.

title: help:comments
body:
h4. Rules

See the list of rules in [[help:community_rules|Community Rules]]. In short:

* Don't insult or abuse other users.
* Don't use hate speech or racist or sexist slurs.
* Don't post unmarked spoilers.
* Don't delete and repost comments to avoid downvotes.
* Don't engage in vote manipulation. This includes creating multiple accounts to vote multiple times, or mass downvoting a user's comments to harass them.
* Write comments in English.

If a comment contains spam or breaks the rules, you can use the Report button to report it to the moderators.

h4. Formatting

All comments are formatted using [[help:dtext|DText]].

h4. Voting

Comments may be upvoted or downvoted. By default, comments with a score of -4 or lower are greyed out, and comments with a score of -8 or lower are hidden. You may adjust this threshold by changing the "Comment threshold" setting in your "account settings":[/settings].

h4. Search

You can use the "comment search page":/comments/search to search for comments by their text, the commenter, and/or the tags on the post the comment belongs to.

You can also use these searches to find posts with comments:

* {{vocaloid comments:>0}} (Vocaloid posts that have comments)
* {{vocaloid order:comment}} (Vocaloid posts, ordered by most recently commented on)
* {{vocaloid order:comment_count}} (Vocaloid posts, ordered by most comments)
* {{comment:"hatsune miku"}} (posts with a comment containing the phrase "Hatsune Miku")
* {{commenter:MD_Anonymous}} (posts commented on by MD_Anonymous)

h4. Moderation

Moderators can view all upvotes and downvotes on comments.

Moderators can view deleted comments. Don't delete and repost your own comments to avoid downvotes.

Moderators can sticky comments by checking the "Sticky" box. Stickied comments are highlighted and are never hidden by downvotes.

title: help:forum
body:
[expand=Table of Contents]
* "Overview":[#dtext-overview]
* "Format":[#dtext-format]
* "Rules":[#dtext-rules]
* "Search":[#dtext-search]
* "Categories":[#dtext-category]
* "Reporting":[#dtext-report]
* "Return":[#dtext-return]
[/expand]

h4#overview. Overview

The forum is the place for discussions related to Danbooru.

h4#format. Formatting

All forum posts are formatted using "DText":/static/dtext_help.

h4#rules. Read the Rules Before Proceeding

* "[b]The Community Guidelines[/b]":[/help/community_rules/]
* Old, legacy forum rules:
** "Rules - Read this before making a thread":[/forum/show/14897/]
** "Civility on the Forum":[/forum/show/57304/]

h4#search. Forum Search

The quick search bar will search through the body only. For more advanced searching, use the "forum post search page":/forum_posts/search, which also allows searching by topic title, author name, and topic category.

h4#category. Forum Categories

Currently, the following categories exist for forum topics:
* "[b]General[/b]":[/forum_topics?search%5Bcategory_id%5D=0]: The default category, for anything that does not fit the other categories.
* "[b]Tags[/b]":[/forum_topics?search%5Bcategory_id%5D=1]: Discussions about new or repopulated tags, tag changes, tag aliases and implications, etc.
** Additionally, you can "request a bulk update":[/bulk_update_requests/new] there.
* "[b]Bugs & Features[/b]":[/forum_topics?search%5Bcategory_id%5D=2]: Discussions related to the Danbooru software (example bugs/inconsistencies or missing features, etc).
** Additionally, you can report bugs or request features at "the Github repository":[https://github.com/r888888888/danbooru/].

h4#report. Reporting

If you believe that a forum post either contains spam or breaks "the Community Guidelines":[/help/community_rules/], you can report it to "the Moderators":/users?commit=Search&search%5Bmin_level%5D=40&search%5Border%5D=date. To report a forum post, click on [b]Report[/b] at the bottom of each forum post. Please enter a valid reason.

h4#return. Go Back

* "Return to Forum":/help/toc#dtext-forum
* "Return to the Table of Contents":/help/toc
* "Return to the Wiki Help Home Page":/help/home

title: help:metatags
body:
Metatags are tags that convey information about an image outside of what is visible in it.

For a list of metatags, see [[tag group:metatags]].

title: help:pixiv_api
body:
h4.Unofficial API specification https://www.snip2code.com/Snippet/798193/Unofficial-API-specification-extracted-f h4.Intro TODO: Document Pixiv's new Public API. See issue #2383 for some information. Pixiv offers an API, called the Public API. It uses OAuth for authentication and JSON for responses. h4. Authentication https://oauth.secure.pixiv.net/auth/token TODO h4. Requests You must include the "Authorization" header with the value "Bearer {ACCESS_TOKEN}", where {ACCESS_TOKEN} is what you received during the authentication step. Make a GET request to the below URL to get information on the work with ID {ILLUST_ID}: [code] https://public-api.secure.pixiv.net/v1/works/{ILLUST_ID}.json [/code] Valid GET parameters known: [b]image_sizes[/b] A comma-delimited list of which sizes of the image URLs you want returned to you. Currently known allowed values: small, medium, large, px_128x128, px_480mw (large refers to the biggest size, /img-original/) [b]profile_image_sizes[/b] A comma-delimited list of which sizes of the artist's avatar URLs you want returned to you. Currently known allowed values: px_170x170, px_50x50 [b]include_stats[/b] Whether to include statistics such as view count for the image or not. Can be: true, false [expand=Example results][code] { "status":"success", "response":[ { "id":49270482, "title":"ツイログ", "caption":null, "tags":[ "神崎蘭子", "双葉杏", "アイドルマスターシンデレラガールズ", "Star!!", "アイマス5000users入り" ], "tools":[ "CLIP STUDIO PAINT" ], "image_urls":{ "large":"http://i3.pixiv.net/img-original/img/2015/03/14/17/53/32/49270482_p0.jpg" }, "width":1200, "height":951, "stats":{ "scored_count":8247, "score":81697, "views_count":191630, "favorited_count":{ "public":7804, "private":745 }, "commented_count":182 }, "publicity":0, "age_limit":"all-age", "created_time":"2015-03-14 17:53:32", "reuploaded_time":"2015-03-14 17:53:32", "user":{ "id":341433, "account":"nardack", "name":"Nardack", "is_following":false, "is_follower":false, "is_friend":false, "is_premium":null, "profile_image_urls":{ "px_50x50":"http://i1.pixiv.net/img19/profile/nardack/846482_s.jpg" }, "stats":null, "profile":null }, "is_manga":true, "is_liked":false, "favorite_id":0, "page_count":2, "book_style":"none", "type":"illustration", "metadata":{ "pages":[ { "image_urls":{ "large":"http://i3.pixiv.net/img-original/img/2015/03/14/17/53/32/49270482_p0.jpg", "medium":"http://i3.pixiv.net/c/1200x1200/img-master/img/2015/03/14/17/53/32/49270482_p0_master1200.jpg" } }, { "image_urls":{ "large":"http://i3.pixiv.net/img-original/img/2015/03/14/17/53/32/49270482_p1.jpg", "medium":"http://i3.pixiv.net/c/1200x1200/img-master/img/2015/03/14/17/53/32/49270482_p1_master1200.jpg" } } ] }, "content_type":null } ], "count":1 } [/code][/expand] See "here":https://gist.github.com/ZipFile/e14ff1a7e6d01456188a for a more complete listing of URLs you can request and their responses. h4. Old API For information on Pixiv's old Smart Phone API, which was removed on May 11th, 2015, see below. [expand=Obsolete SPAPI] Pixiv offers an API through several URLs: [code] http://spapi.pixiv.net/iphone/illust.php?illust_id={IDLIST} # individual images (comma-delimited list of IDs) http://spapi.pixiv.net/iphone/manga.php?illust_id={ID} # list of each page of a manga separately http://spapi.pixiv.net/iphone/novel.php?id={NOVEL_ID} # individual novel (does not support list of IDs) http://spapi.pixiv.net/iphone/new_illust.php # list of newest posts on pixiv http://spapi.pixiv.net/iphone/new_novel.php # list of newest novels on pixiv http://spapi.pixiv.net/iphone/new_novel_r18.php # list of newest R-18 novels on pixiv http://spapi.pixiv.net/iphone/bookmark_user_new_novel.php # list of newest novels from users you have bookmarked http://spapi.pixiv.net/iphone/mypixiv_new_novel.php # list of newest novels from your friends http://spapi.pixiv.net/iphone/ranking.php?mode={day/week/month} # daily/weekly/monthly ranking http://spapi.pixiv.net/iphone/search.php?s_mode={SEARCHMODE}&word={QUERY} # search http://spapi.pixiv.net/iphone/search_user.php?nick={USERNAME} # search users http://spapi.pixiv.net/iphone/member_illust.php?id={USERID} # view posts by specific user http://spapi.pixiv.net/iphone/member_novel.php?id={USERID} # view novels by specific user http://spapi.pixiv.net/iphone/illust_comments.php?illust_id={ID} # view comments on an image http://spapi.pixiv.net/iphone/novel_comments.php?id={NOVEL_ID} # view comments on a novel http://spapi.pixiv.net/iphone/user.php # returns the current user http://spapi.pixiv.net/iphone/user.php?level={1|2|3} # returns the current user. increasing level parameter increases the number of fields returned. http://spapi.pixiv.net/iphone/mypixiv_all.php?id={USER_ID} # friends list http://spapi.pixiv.net/iphone/bookmark.php?id={USER_ID}&rest={show|hide} # bookmarked images. rest=show mean public, rest=hide means private. http://spapi.pixiv.net/iphone/bookmark_novel.php?id={USER_ID}&rest={show|hide} # bookmarked novels http://spapi.pixiv.net/iphone/bookmark_user_all.php?id={USER_ID}&rest={show|hide} # bookmarked users http://spapi.pixiv.net/iphone/novel_text.php?id={NOVEL_ID} # body of this novel http://spapi.pixiv.net/iphone/novel_series.php?series_id={SERIES_ID} # list of novels in this series http://spapi.pixiv.net/iphone/novel_bookmarks.php?id={NOVEL_ID} # list of users who bookmarked this novel http://spapi.pixiv.net/iphone/novel_marker_all.php http://spapi.pixiv.net/iphone/hot_tags.php [/code] The PHPSESSID parameter from your login cookie should be included in the query to access R-18 content. If you append &c_mode=count to the end, you'll receive the number of results returned by that search instead of the results themselves. If you append &p={PAGE} you can change pages. There are 50 results per page. For images that have been deleted (i.e., bad id), or if you query for a R-18 image but don't pass a valid PHPSESSID, the API returns a "200 OK" HTTP code but an empty response. Private images (MyPicks, etc...) have an illust id of 0 and a generic thumbnail. Responses are unlabeled CSV documents. title: help:pawoo_api
body:
For up to date details on the Pawoo API, see https://github.com/pixiv/mastodon. h4. Set up a Pawoo account To access the API on Pawoo, you must have a Pawoo account. See [[Howto:Pawoo]] for details. h4. Get an access token Perform a GET using your credentials to any Pawoo /web url, e.g. [nodtext]https://pawoo.net/web/accounts/$ID_NUMBER[/nodtext], where $ID_NUMBER is the account ID. This can even be your own account ID. Scrape the HTML for the JSON. This can be done using the following regex: [code] [/code] After importing the JSON, grab the access token using the [code]['meta']['access_token'][/code] key. h4. Queries Pawoo posts, which are equivalent to Twitter tweets, are called toots below. h5. Account h6. Account Information [table] [tbody] [tr] [td]URL[/td] [td][nodtext]https://pawoo.net/api/v1/accounts/$ID[/nodtext][/td] [/tr] [tr] [td]Method[/td] [td][nodtext]GET[/nodtext][/td] [/tr] [/tbody] [/table] [tn][b]Note:[/b]$ID is the account ID.[/tn] h6. Account toots [table] [tbody] [tr] [td]URL[/td] [td][nodtext]https://pawoo.net/api/v1/accounts/$ID/statuses[/nodtext][/td] [/tr] [tr] [td]Method[/td] [td][nodtext]GET[/nodtext][/td] [/tr] [/tbody] [/table] [tn][b]Note:[/b]$ID is the account ID.[/tn] * Parameters: ** max_id: Largest ID allowed ** since_id: Lowest ID allowed ** only_media: 1 for true, 0 for false ** exclude_replies: 1 for true, 0 for false h5. Toots h5. title: help:pokemon_tags
body:
These are the standards concerning the various kinds of [i][[pokemon|Pokémon]][/i] tags.

h4. Tagging human characters

* Use English names for human characters, with the (pokemon) qualifier.
** Ex.: [[sabrina (pokemon)]], [[brock (pokemon)]], etc.
* Use English names for trainer classes, with the (pokemon) qualifier.
** Ex.: [[lass_(pokemon)]], [[swimmer_(pokemon)]], [[fisher_(pokemon)]], etc.
* As an exception, human characters with surnames don't have the qualifier.
** Ex.: [[tracey sketchit]], [[blue oak]], etc. (not [[blue_oak_(pokemon)]])

Pokemon tags were formerly partly grandfathered-in tags, where human characters were originally referred to by their Japanese names in compliance with usual Danbooru standards, despite having English names on exported versions. The English names were sometimes available as aliases, especially in the case of major characters such as players and rivals. However, as raised in topic #17160, this created an inconsistency with the use of the English names of the Pokemon themselves and other terms used in the franchise as well as several other factors that had to be addressed, thus the reversal, marking Pokemon tags as completely grandfathered-in copyright tags. See our [[howto:copyright|Copyright Tag Guidelines]] for more info about "grandfathered-in copyright tags".

Most human characters are known by a single name (they lack a full name) such as "Misty" and would be likely ambiguous with characters from other copyrights, hence the (pokemon) qualifier.

Trainer classes are often descriptive words such as "Swimmer" or "Lass", so English trainer classes are used. They would often clash with common English vocabulary, so the (pokemon) qualifier is used here as well.

See [[List of Pokemon characters]] for all names.

h4. Tagging Pokémon species

* Simply use the English names of Pokémon species.
** Ex.: [[pikachu]], [[mewtwo]], etc.
* There are ten species that require the (pokemon) qualifier:
** [[gloom_(pokemon)]], [[golem_(pokemon)]],  [[electrode_(pokemon)]], [[kabuto_(pokemon)]], [[mew_(pokemon)]], [[roselia_(pokemon)]],[[deino_(pokemon)]], [[chi-yu_(pokemon)]], [[ting-lu_(pokemon)]] and [[iron_hands_(pokemon)]].

* For a regional form, use just "alolan_(species)", "galarian_(species)", "hisuian_(species)" or "paldean_(species)". Don't use just "(species)".
** Ex.: Alolan Meowth should be tagged just [[alolan_meowth]], not [[meowth]].
** Ex.: Galarian Meowth should be tagged just [[galarian_meowth]], not [[meowth]].
** Ex.: Hisuian Braviary should be tagged just [[hisuian_braviary]], not [[braviary]].
** Ex.: Paldean Wooper should be tagged just [[paldean_wooper]], not [[wooper]].

Owing to their sheer number (1008 registered species, as of the Scarlet and Violet versions), remembering their English names is no easy task, much less their Japanese names. The Japanese names of Pokémon also cover many highly-ambiguous words that can and will conflict with other characters, artists, and objects. (Beedrill = "Spear" in Japanese; Magnemite = "Coil" in Japanese, etc.)

Historically, Japanese names had been applicable to newer Pokémon as temporary tags, when necessary, until their English names became officially available. However, in the latest generations, the English and Japanese names have been usually released at the same time.

Some miscellaneous tags about Pokémon species, such as [[shiny_pokemon]] and [[clothed_pokemon]], are also available.

See [[list_of_pokemon|List of Pokémon]] for all names.

h4. Tagging media

* Use game tags to group human characters and designs from various games.
** Ex.: [[pokemon_rgby]], [[pokemon_sm]], [[pokemon_swsh]], etc.
* Use anime series tags to group human characters and designs from different anime series.
** Ex.: [[pokemon_(classic_anime)]], [[pokemon_dppt_(anime)]], [[pokemon_sm_(anime)]], etc.
* Other media tags are available as well:
** Ex.: [[pokemon adventures]], [[pokemon pocket monsters]], etc.
* Make sure to check the different designs of each character to see where it fits.
** Ex.: Red is visibly different in [i]RGBY[/i], [i]FRLG[/i], [i]SM[/i] and [i]LGPE[/i], so various posts depicting Red are expected to have different media tags. Many game characters also have different designs when they appear in remakes.
* In the vast majority of cases, don't use game tags for Pokémon species.
** Ex.: Posts depicting a Squirtle should not be tagged [[pokemon_rgby]]. (unless there are human characters from that game in the post as well) All the same, posts depicting a [[Wooloo]] should not be tagged [[pokemon_swsh]].
* As an exception, [[official art]] posts depicting a Pokémon may use game tags.
** Ex.: Official art of Charizard from FRLG may be tagged [[pokemon_frlg]]. Official art of Wooloo from SwSh may be tagged [[pokemon_swsh]].

A post depicting a Pokémon species is not necessarily a visible reference to any game in particular.

For instance, adding [[pokemon_swsh]] to a Wooloo post (post #3528342) would be a mistake, because Wooloo is expected to appear in other media as well.

Discussion: topic #15030.

See [[List of Pokemon media]] for all forms of media.

h4. Prototype Pokémon

Prototype Pokémon are the unused Pokémon designs and creatures. They sometimes appear in fan art.

* All prototype Pokémon have their own tags and don't use normal Pokémon tags. Examples:
** post #3360231 - the correct tag is [[girafarig_(prototype)]], not [[girafarig]].
** post #3355587 - the correct tag is [[gyarados_(prototype)]], not [[gyarados]].
** post #3148107 - the correct tag is [[rai_(raikou)]], not [[raikou]].
** post #3148591 - the correct tag is [[leafy_(leafeon)]], not [[leafeon]].
* Prototype versions having the same names as normal Pokémon have the (prototype) qualifier.
** Ex.: [[igglybuff_(prototype)]] (to distinguish from the normal [[igglybuff]]), [[gyarados_(prototype)]], [[pichu_(prototype)]], [[girafarig_(prototype)]], etc.
* Whenever possible, use a name found in official sources (which are usually in Japanese).
** Ex.: Some prototype Pokémon have been found, with their respective names, in the [i]Gold[/i]/[i]Silver[/i] from Space World 1997: Hanamogura, Honooguma, Volbear, Dynabear, etc.
* Don't use fan translations as tags. Stick to the "official" Japanese names as said above. (sometimes fanart and fan sites use fan translations, but please ignore them) Feel free to mention major fan translations in the wiki pages (such as those by The Cutting Room Floor).
** Ex.: The website The Cutting Room Floor translated the Pokémon names from Space World 1997: Koonya (original) became Meowsy (fan translation), Haneko (original) became Lefmew (fan translation), etc.
* A prototype Pokémon is often found in a single game and is unlikely to appear in other games and media such as anime and manga, so it may use the normal game tag, as well as the prototype game tag.
** Ex.: All posts depicting [[pichu_(prototype)]] should be tagged [[pokemon_gsc]], as well as [[pokemon_gsc_(prototype)]].

Lists of prototype Pokémon:

* [[pokemon_rgby_(prototype)]]
* [[pokemon_gsc_(prototype)]]
* [[pokemon_rse_(prototype)]]
* [[pokemon_dppt_(prototype)]]

title: howto:yandere
body:
"Yande.re":[https://yande.re] is an anime art board running "Moebooru":[https://github.com/moebooru/moebooru], a heavily-modified fork of the Danbooru 1 software. Sometimes, you may want to upload an image from Yande.re to Danbooru.

h4. When to upload

If the image was posted to Yande.re from another site, such as the artist's Pixiv or homepage, and that page is still available, upload from that site instead. Only upload from Yande.re if it is a [[scan]]. On Yande.re, pictures that aren't scans should have a Source field, while scans do not, but you can double-check by using a "reverse image search":[/wiki_pages/67137#dtext-reverse-image].

h4. Uploading

h5. Fullsize image

Pasting the yande.re link (example: https://yande.re/post/show/1073271) into danbooru's upload box will lead to danbooru automatically fetching the highest quality version from yande.re. Alternatively, you can use the "bookmarklet":[/static/bookmarklet] on the yande.re post page. 

[b]Note:[/b] Yande.re contains posts greater than 100MB in filesize (example: https://yande.re/post/show/1086192). These are currently not uploadable to danbooru.  Under those circumstances, using the next best image is allowed.  This will be the JPEG version if it exists, and the SAMPLE image if it does not.  See [b]Image Link Format[/b] below for an explanation of those terms.

h4. Maintentance

h5. Post source

The image URL may look strange (for example, it may contain a long list of tags at the end) but don't adjust it; After upload, Danbooru will automatically display a prettified version as the source if you leave it as-is.

title: howto:artist
body:
The "artist library":[/artists] is a specialized database on Danbooru that serves both as a resource for artist homepages, and also as a way to determine the artist of an upload by parsing the URL it came from.

Making an artist entry can be a bit of a tricky endeavor, so this howto should explain how to go about it.

h2. How to find an artist's name

On most art sites, the artist's name should be prominently displayed somewhere on their profile or alongside the post the art comes from. For smaller sites like an artist's home page or blog, information usually come in "about", "profile", "info", "link", "プロファイル", "インフォ", "アバウト", or "管理人" page. The artist's name may appear after "PN", "HN", "管理人", "名前", etc. Their circle or site name may appear after "サイト名" or "HP".

Many Japanese artists will give their name in kanji, which may make it difficult to romanize. Sites like "Tangorin":[http://tangorin.com/names/] can offer assistance with this. If there are multiple readings given, try to see if there is a connection between one of them and the artist's pixiv or Twitter username, site name or link, or email address. If you can't figure it out, you can ask in topic #8199 and someone will be able to offer you help.

If the artist's name is in kana, you can romanize their name yourself using the tables on Wikipedia for "hiragana":[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hiragana] or "katakana":[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Katakana]. [[howto:romanize]] contains Danbooru's guidelines on romanization.

If the tag name you want to use already exists, you must qualify it with the artist's group name or handle from a site.

h2. How to make an artist entry

Ideally this should be done before you tag and post the art, as creating an artist entry will automatically create an associated artist tag and allows automatically fetching the artist from a source post. To create an entry, click the "create new artist" link on the upload page, or go to the "new artist page":[/artists/new]. Using the link from the upload page will automatically populate the artist entry with an artist name, other names, and URLs, if the site is supported by Danbooru. The automatically populated artist name may not be ideal, so you are free to change it to a better name as determined by the previous section.

If you've created a general (blue) tag by mistake, you have to change it to an artist tag before Danbooru will allow you to make an artist entry with that name. To do that, you can simple prefix the tag name with [code]art:[/code] or [code]artist:[/code], or by finding it on the "tags listing":[/tags] and clicking "Edit". Note that you should not do this for existing tags, only ones you have created as the wrong category by mistake. 

h4. Other Names

These are generally what you should add in this field:

* Names in kanji
* Names in kana
* Site name
* Circle name
* pixiv nickname (find under pixiv avatar)
* pixiv username (find in the pixiv stacc feed URL)
* Twitter name
* Usernames or handles from any other site

h4. Group

This is usually the circle name. Only one group name is supported, as commas and spaces are considered part of the name. Unlike tag names, the group name supports any characters and thus you should use the original spelling and stylization of the name, including CJK characters, asterisks, and capitalization.

h4. URLs 

All links that are useful in finding arts and information about the artist.

* Home Page
* Circle Home Page
* Blog
* pixiv account, including stacc URL if you can find it
* Twitter account, including intent URL if you can find it
* NicoVideo account, with both of the NicoSeiga user/illust/### and user/illust/###?target=illust_all links included
* All other social accounts you can find (DeviantArt, Lofter, Weibo, etc.)

[b]Do not remove dead URLs.[/b] See topic #8048 for the many reasons why you should leave them alone. Instead, add a - in front of the URL to mark it as dead.

h4. See also

* [[Help:Artists]]
* "Table of Contents":[/help/toc]

title: about:mod_queue
body:
h4. What is Danbooru's Moderation Queue?

Danbooru's Moderation Queue (usually referred to as "modqueue") is a system in place to filter out images which do not meet [[help:upload|Danbooru's Quality Standards]].

[[help:users|Approvers]] are responsible for approving posts in the queue ([[help:users]]). You can view a list of them "here":/users?commit=Search&search%5Blevel%5D=>=37.

h4. How does the modqueue work?

h6. In Short:
1. A new post is uploaded by an user who is below [[help:users|contributor level]].
2. The post is placed in the modqueue.
3. Approvers review the post.
4. If there are no approvals within 3 days, the post is deleted.
5. If any approver approves the post, the approved post is now active and remains on Danbooru indefinitely.
6. If the post is flagged by another user, go to Step 2.

Posts which are in the Queue are distinguished by their blue border when browsing thumbnails. 

The full Queue may be listed by using the search metatag [b]{{status:pending}}[/b]. Approvers may use [b]{{status:unmoderated}}[/b] outside of the modqueue interface to see the pending posts they haven't made a decision on.

h6. Exceptions and Exemptions:

"All contributors and above":/help/users can post directly to active status, bypassing the modqueue. This privilege is given to frequent uploaders with a track record of uploading consistently high-quality art, to allow them to contribute to the collection without the constraints of the modqueue.

h4. Help Us Keep Our Gallery Clean!

If you find a particularly low quality post that doesn't belong on Danbooru, you may [[howto:flag|flag]] the post to have it return to the modqueue for a second check.

Simply open the post in full view, and click on [b]Flag[/b] on the left pane, third choice from the top under [b]Options[/b]. You will be prompted to enter your reason for returning the post to the Queue. Click on OK, and the image's approval will be reconsidered.

h4. What should I do about my deleted Posts?

Most of the time, it is safe to assume that every post in the Queue has been reviewed at least once.

If an upload isn't approved after three days, it is mostly because it doesn't meet our quality standards. It is comparatively rare for a high-quality post to end up getting deleted because the Queue missed it.

With the understanding that the manual and subjective process of the modqueue has its inherent flaws, post deletions may be appealed. For information on lodging a deletion appeal, please consult [[howto:appeal|the article on appeals]].

h4. Go Back

* "Return to the Terms of Service and Moderation section of the Table of Contents":/wiki_pages/help:toc#dtext-terms_of_service_and_moderation
* "Return to the Table of Contents":/help/toc
* "Return to the Wiki Help Home Page":/help/home

title: garreg_mach_monastery_uniform
body:
The uniform used for the students from the Garreg Mach Monastery’s Officers Academy in [[Fire Emblem: Three Houses]].

It comes in several small variations that adapt to each student's personality, common elements include a [[long_sleeves|long sleeved]] [[white shirt]], a [[black coat]] or a [[black dress]] with [[gold trim]], a [[white neckerchief]], a [[high-waist_skirt|high-waist]] [[black skirt]] and a [[black vest]].

The House Leaders additionally include a [[cape]] in their uniform, being, [[red cape|red]], [[blue cape|blue]] or [[yellow cape|yellow]] depending the Class they belong.

title: stove
body:
A kitchen appliance that is related to the oven. It is an enclosed space that is heated with fire or coals in order to cook food or heat a room.
Known in Japan as 焜炉/コンロ ([i]konro[/i]) or ガス台. For the device called stove in Japan, see [[heater]].

h4. Types

h5. Cooking specific

* [[Portable stove]]
** [[Backpacking stove]]
* [[Hot plate]]

h5. Cooking and heating (note: not all versions of these are intended for cooking)

* [[Kerosene heater]]
* [[Potbelly stove]]
* [[Wood-burning stove]]

h4. Additional equipment

* [[Fish grill]] (an integrated grill/broiler in some Japanese stove tops)
* [[Kitchen range]] (an appliance that integrates a stove top with an [[oven]])

h4.See also

* [[Brazier]]
** [[Hibachi_(object)|]]
* [[Fire pit]]
* [[Fireplace]]
* [[Grill]]

title: kannazuki_sora
body:
Taimanin, the child of a retired Taimanin who married a normal human. When she was little, she lived a peaceful, ordinary life, but her parents were murdered by demons who had a grudge against her Taimanin mother and she was sold to the Chaos Arena.

She lived in fear, not knowing Taimanins, demons, or any evil of the world, but was rescued a few days later by a Taimanin force that attacked the Chaos Arena by surprise. Because of the trauma normal life has become hard and she was taken in by Gosha Village. 

She is an [[Action Taimanin]] original character

title: microwave
body:
Also called a microwave oven, it is a kitchen appliance that uses dielectric heating to warm up food.

Not to be confused with a [[toaster oven]], a small countertop oven of similar shape.  Generally identifiable by the handle at the top of the door instead of the on the side with microwave.

title: i'm_at_soup_(meme)
body: A bizarre conversation from the [[Code Geass]] parody "Code MENT Episode 16":[https://youtu.be/72mcTwEleno?t=143&list=PL6BA3366BBC0ACDAC], in which [[Lelouch Vi Britannia|Lelouch]] calls [[Kururugi Suzaku|Suzaku]] for help only to end up confused and frustrated about what Suzaku is currently in the middle of. This became the subject of many memes and parodies, including a "Japanese parody":[https://twitter.com/SanicBushpig/status/1227072426347024385], and "one Team Fortress 2-themed parody":[https://youtu.be/4kqbKEqzsAI] that actually dwarfs the original in terms of viewcount.

title: insect_cage
body: A cage used to hold collected [[bug]]s, a common pastime for Japanese children in the summer. Usually green.

title: waterful_ring-toss
body: A water-based ring toss toy developed by Tomy during the 1970s. Upon being filled with water, players press a button on the side, which forces air through a tube into the main compartment and sends the rings flying. Many consider it a piece of childhood nostalgia given that it required a degree of skill to set all rings onto the pegs. Variants were developed and sold by Milton Bradley and other companies.

title: thermite_grenade
body:
A type of [[explosive|hand]] [[grenade]] designed for anti-materiel destructive purpose. It contains incendiary aluminum powder and metal oxides that can produce devastating heat (approximately 2500°C) when ignited.

It is well-known in [[Apex Legends]], identifiable by the red coloring and distinct shape.
While in real life many thermite grenades have same external shape as [[smoke grenade]]s, tubular casing with a [[grenade pin|pin]] but features different markings.

h1. See also
* [[dynamite]]
* [[List of Weapons]]

h1. External links
* "Wikipedia: Thermite#Military uses":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thermite#Military_uses

title: kuronuma_sawako
body:
The main character of [[Kimi ni Todoke]].
She has [[brown eyes|brown]] or [[black eyes]] and [[straight hair|straight]], [[long hair|long]] [[black hair]] (with [[blunt bangs]]).

In the book/anime, everybody around her fears her because of her unusual appearance and the fact that her name also sound very close to [[Yamamura Sadako]] from [[The Ring]]. People would even call her Sadako, either by accident or on purpose.

Her motto is "A good deed a day," but it's usually hard for her due to the fact everybody runs away screaming whenever they see her.

title: minaret
body:
A [b]minaret[/b] is a type of [[tower]] typically built into or adjacent to [[mosque]]s. Minarets are generally used to project the Muslim call to prayer (adhan), but they also served as landmarks. They can have a variety of forms, from thick, squat towers to soaring, pencil-thin [[spire]]s.

For similar counterpart found on churches or cathedrals, see [[steeple]].

h1. See also
* [[building]]
* [[dome]]
* [[Middle Eastern architecture]]

h1. External links
* "Wikipedia: Minaret":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Minaret
