title: magical_mirai_miku_(2020_summer)
body:
The 2020 [[Magical Mirai (Vocaloid)|]] summer version of [[Hatsune Miku]].

The theme for this year was "Festival". Due to the 2020 Summer Olympics taking place around the same time that Magical Mirai would usually take place, the concerts this year were moved to late Autumn. Thus this year's Magical Mirai Miku received a summer and winter version, both designed by [[Fuzichoco]].

The summer version of Miku has a traditional Japanese theme with a pink, aqua, and black color palette. She wears a festive [[yukata]] with very [[wide sleeves]], pink and aqua [[bowtie|bowties]], and a [[single thighhigh]]. She carries a black [[folding fan]] and has a ring of floating [[drum|drums]] and [[speaker|speakers]] with [[cherry blossom print]] behind her.

The theme song this year was [[aisarenakute_mo_kimi_ga_iru_(vocaloid)|Aisarenakute mo kimi ga iru]] by [[Pinocchio-P]].

h4. Official art
* Main Visual: post #3776901
* Character Sheet: post #4005613

h4. See also
* [[Magical Mirai Miku (2020 Winter)]]
* [[Magical Mirai Miku]]
* [[List of Vocaloid derivatives]]

title: magical_mirai_miku_(2020_winter)
body:
The 2020 [[Magical Mirai (Vocaloid)|]] winter version of [[Hatsune Miku]].

The theme for this year was "Festival". Due to the 2020 Summer Olympics taking place around the same time that Magical Mirai would usually take place, the concerts this year were moved to late Autumn. Thus this year's Magical Mirai Miku received a summer and winter version, both designed by [[Fuzichoco]].

The winter version of Miku has a fur-trimmed, pastel pink, blue, and white theme. She wears a [[fur-trimmed dress]] with very wide shawl-like sleeves, pastel pink and blue [[bowtie|bowties]], [[mismatched gloves|mismatched]] pink and blue gloves, and a [[single thighhigh]] with [[star print]]. She also carries a [[handbell]] and has a ring of bells floating behind her.

The theme song this year was [[aisarenakute_mo_kimi_ga_iru_(vocaloid)|Aisarenakute mo kimi ga iru]] by [[Pinocchio-P]].

title: safe_(container)
body:
A [b]safe[/b] (also called a strongbox or coffer) is a secure lockable [[box]] used for securing valuable objects ([[jewelry]], [[money]], [[weapon]], etc.), against theft and/or damage from fire. Usually made of metal.

* [[padlock]]

title: chest_(furniture)
body:
A chest (also called coffer or kist) is a form of furniture typically of a rectangular structure with a hinged lid on top, used for storage, often associated with treasure and other valuables. The interior space may be subdivided. 

[b]Not to be confused[/b] with [[crate]], chests tend to have more ornate design and crates have removable lid.
h1. See also
* [[container]]
* [[safe (container)]]

title: nasal_cannula
body:
The [b]nasal cannula[/b] is a device used to deliver supplemental oxygen or increased airflow to a patient or person in need of respiratory help. It consists of a lightweight elastic tube which on one end splits into two prongs which are placed in the nostrils and from which a mixture of air and oxygen flows.

h1. See also
* [[intravenous drip]]
* [[oxygen mask]]

h1. External links
* "Wikipedia: Nasal cannula":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nasal_cannula

title: iv_stand
body: The pole for hanging the bag(s) for an [[intravenous drip]] or [[blood bag|blood]] transfusion. The stereotypical IV stand generally has a distinctive pair of curlicued hooks at the top, and is usually wheeled so that the patient can bring it along when moving about.  Some are height-adjustable for use when sitting or standing.  They can also be built into/attached to [[hospital]] beds, gurneys, or wheelchairs.

title: ghost_of_tsushima
body:
[b]Ghost of Tsushima[/b] is a 2020 action and adventure [[video game]] developed by "Sucker Punch Productions":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sucker_Punch_Productions and published by [[Sony]] Interactive Entertainment. The player controls [[Sakai Jin]], a [[samurai]] on a quest to protect Tsushima Island during the "first Mongol invasion":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mongol_invasions_of_Japan#First_invasion_(1274) of [[Japan]]. 

Jin must choose between following the warrior code to fight honorably, or using practical but dishonorable methods of repelling the Mongols with minimal casualties. The game features a large open world which can be explored either on foot or on horseback. When facing enemies, the player can choose to engage in a direct confrontation using Jin's [[katana]] or to become a legendary warrior known as "the Ghost" by using stealth tactics to assassinate opponents. 

Sucker Punch began developing the game  in 2014 with a heavy emphasis on melee combat. The studio collaborated with "Japan Studio":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Japan_Studio and visited Tsushima Island twice to ensure that the game was as culturally and historically authentic as possible. The team was heavily inspired by samurai cinema, particularly films directed by "Kurosawa Akira":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Akira_Kurosawa , as well as the comic book series [[Usagi Yojimbo]]. The game's landscape and minimalistic art style were influenced by [[Shadow of the Colossus]], and locations in the game were designed to be "the perfect photographer's dream". While the in-game landmass is similar in shape to "Tsushima Island":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tsushima_Island , the team did not intend to create a one-to-one recreation. Ilan Eshkeri and Umebayashi Shigeru composed the game's soundtrack.

The game was released for [[PlayStation 4]] in July 2020, and an expanded version for PlayStation 4 and [[PlayStation 5]], subtitled Director's Cut and featuring the "Iki Island":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Iki_Island expansion, was released in August 2021. A multiplayer mode titled Ghost of Tsushima: Legends was released in October 2020 and made available separately in September 2021.

The game received positive reviews upon release, with critics praising the game's melee combat, story, characters, performances, and music, though it received some criticism for its implementations of stealth gameplay and open world structure. The game was a commercial success, selling more than 9.73 million copies by July 2022 and was one of Sony's fastest-selling original games. It was nominated for several end-of-the-year awards, including Game of the Year at The Game Awards 2020 and 24th Annual D.I.C.E. Awards. A film adaptation is in development as of 2022.

title: nakai_hisao
body:
[[katawa_shoujo|Katawa Shoujo]]'s protagonist.

Hisao is a male high school student with arrhythmia. In the prologue he collapses from a heart attack after receiving a confession from the girl he likes. He is detained for several months in a hospital, during which they break off relations.  

Due to his condition, Hisao cannot return to a normal high school. Instead he is transfered to Yamaku High School, a school for the disabled.

Hisao's main hobby is reading, which was his sole escape from the boredom of staying in the hospital. Before his heart attack, he also used to play soccer casually with friends.

Hisao has [[brown eyes]] and [[messy hair|messy]] [[brown hair]] with an [[ahoge]]. He usually wears the [[Yamaku high school uniform]]; when in casual clothes he is usually wearing a distinctive-looking [[sweater vest]] with a grey checkerboard pattern. His chest has a [[scar]] from heart surgery, though how noticeable it is varies by artist.

title: salem_(rwby)
body:
Salem is the primary antagonist in [[RWBY]], A 3DCG Series created by Rooster Teeth.


h4.Abilities

She is capable of both wielding magic and controlling the [[grimm (rwby)|]], and is immortal. 


h4. Physical Characteristics 

Salem has [[white hair]] and [[red eyes]] with [[black sclera]]e. Her skin is [[white_skin|chalk-white]] with prominent purple [[veins]]. In the middle of her forehead is a black diamond-shaped [[forehead_jewel|gem]]. When she is angry she becomes surrounded by a purple-black [[dark aura]].

h4. Attire 

She wears a [[black_dress | black dress]] with red streaks and a [[cleavage_cutout | cleavage cutout]] in the middle of her chest.

h4. External Links

title: mecha_knight
body:
The fourth boss faced by [[Kirby]] in [[Kirby: Planet Robobot]]. After [[Meta Knight]] tried to take on the invading Haltmann Works Company, he was captured and remodeled by [[susie_(kirby)|Susie]] into a battle cyborg. He was equipped with missiles, lasers, and an altered version of his [[galaxia_(sword)|Galaxia]]. A subsequent upgrade named Mecha Knight+ gives him a large, [[scorpion]]-like tail.

A mass produced version called Stock Mecha Knight can be found in Meta Knightmare Returns and the True Arena.

title: muv-luv:_dimensions
body:
A [[Muv-Luv Alternative]] gacha game for smartphones, released on March 17, 2022. The game was pulled from storefronts within 48 hours of launching due to severe technical issues, and relaunched on July 11, 2023.

Originally announced and launched as [b]Immortals: Muv-Luv Alternative[/b], it was rebranded to MuvLuv: Dimensions prior to relaunching.

The game is set in an alternate universe from the rest of the franchise, where an international PMC called Immortals leads mankind's fight against the [[Beta (muv-luv)|B.E.T.A.]] in the year 20XX. This alternate setting has allowed the game to feature characters from different time periods and countries of the original works as part of the same force.

The first release includes:
* [[Muv-Luv Unlimited: The Day After]] Episode 0
* Chicken Divers - a short story about an elite [[F-15E Strike Eagle]] piloting orbital diver unit.
* Rain Dancers - a short story about a joint European force utilizing the brand new [[EF-2000 Typhoon (muv-luv)|]] in attempts to gain a foothold against the [[BETA (muv-luv)|]].

title: weather_vane
body:
An instrument for showing the direction of the wind.

They are typically used as an architectural ornament to the highest point of a building. Although partly functional, weather vanes are generally decorative, often featuring the traditional cockerel design with letters indicating the points of the compass. The word 'vane' comes from the Anglo-Saxon word 'fane' meaning 'flag'.

h4. See Also
* [[Stevenson screen]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Weather vane":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Weather_vane

title: stevenson_screen
body:
A Stevenson screen, sometimes referred to as an instrument shelter, is a shelter placed on exposed weather equipment to protect the instruments from the elements.

The most common model is a free-standing box design with a slanted roof, though other designs exist. They also have rows of slats on the sides called louvers which are designed to allow air to pass through, similar to the slats on window blinds.

h4. See Also
* [[weather]]
* [[weather vane]]

h4. External Links
* "Wikipedia: Stevenson screen":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stevenson_screen]

title: takahashi_amato
body:
A [[CeVIO]] voicebank. He is the first male voicebank on the engine. Initially released with just his surname, he eventually received the given name "Amato" after a "name guessing contest":[https://cevio.jp/archives/17687/] was run on "Twitter":[https://twitter.com/CeVIO_st/status/1661930160466313217] for his 10th anniversary.

He has [[brown hair]] and [[brown eyes]]. He wears a grey [[dress shirt]] and [[white jacket]] with matching [[grey pants]].

title: ladies_versus_butlers!
body:
Ladies versus Butlers! (れでぃ×ばと! Redi×Bato!) is a Japanese light novel series written by Tsukasa Kōzuki, with accompanying illustrations by [[munyuu|Munyū]]. The series includes 13 novels released between September 2006 and March 2012, published by ASCII Media Works under their Dengeki Bunko imprint.

A manga adaptation by the illustrator group Nekoyashiki-Nekomaru was serialized in ASCII Media Works' Dengeki Moeoh magazine between the June 2008 and December 2008 issues. A drama CD based on the novels was released in September 2009. A 12-episode anime adaptation produced by Xebec and directed by Atsushi Ōtsuki aired in Japan between January and March 2010. The anime has been licensed by Media Blasters for release in North America.

body:
A [[Muv-Luv]] magazine documenting the future after the events of [[Muv-Luv Alternative]], as well as planned story elements for [[muv-luv alternative strike frontier|Strike Frontier]] that did not make it into the game due to it's discontinuation.

The future elements shown in the magazine were later referenced in the epilogue to Alternative's manga adaptation.

title: muv-luv_altered_fable
body:
A [[Muv-Luv]] visual novel released in 2007. It's initial release came packaged with Faraway Dawn (a hexagonal grid based strategy game in the Alternative timeline) and a demo for [[muv-luv total eclipse|Total Eclipse]]. An all-ages version was released in 2014 as part of the Photon Melodies sidestory collection.

It is currently the only work by age to revisit the light-hearted high school setting of MuvLuv Extra following the release of [[Muv-Luv Alternative]].

body:

The entries in this subseries were originally released as part of [[Muv-Luv Alternative Chronicles]], but were later released as standalone titles on Steam.

Series creator Yoshimune Kouki has stated that the upcoming visual novel [[Muv-Luv Resonative]] will be the finale to this saga.

title: muv-luv_alternative_(anime)
body:
The anime adaptation of [[Muv-Luv Alternative]], which features a completely different art style from the visual novel and an entirely new voice cast. The new cast has effectively replaced the original VAs, as the anime cast reprised their roles in [[Project MIKHAIL]] and are planned to continue doing so for any future projects featuring the original characters.

It initially ran from October 7 to December 22, 2021 and a second season began airing in October 2022.

The anime is closer to the manga adaptation than the original VN, as it includes several manga-original scenes and characters (such as [[Komaki Sayoko]]).

This tag should be used for posts that feature or reference anime-original aspects such as:
* the character and/or [[fortified suit]] redesigns
* [[Voice actor|seiyuu]] related posts based on the new voice cast
* characters and events introduced in the anime-original first episode 
* direct references to the adaptation's version of plot events
* any [[official art|official]], [[promotional art|promotional]], or [[production art]] related to the anime

h1. External Links
* "Official Website":[https://muv-luv-alternative-anime.com/]
* "Official Twitter":[https://twitter.com/Muv_Luv_A_anime]

title: muv-luv_alternative
body:
[[Science fiction]] visual novel by âge, and the third part of the original [[Muv-Luv]] trilogy. After the events of Muv-Luv Unlimited, [[Shirogane Takeru]] awakens in his room once again, though this time with his memories from Unlimited.

Alternative is the most well regarded and popular part of the series, and the original VN inspired several spin-offs and sidestories including [[Muv-luv Total Eclipse|Total Eclipse]], [[The Euro Front]], [[Schwarzesmarken]], and [[muv-luv alternative strike Frontier|Strike Frontier]]. 

A manga adaptation illustrated by [[Makishima Azusa]] was published from August 21, 2007 to April 27, 2017. This adaptation added extra scenes from other characters' points of view that were not present in the original VN. An [[muv-luv alternative (anime)|anime adaptation]] began airing in 2021, with two games ([[Project MIKHAIL]] and [[Muv-luv: Dimensions|Immortals: Muv-Luv Alternative]]) launching to accompany it.

h4. See Also
* [[fortified suit]]
* [[tactical surface fighter]]
* [[Try to scream... and I'll choke you with my breasts (meme)]]
other_names: マブラヴオルタネイティヴ

title: shirogane_takeru
body:
Protagonist of [[Muv-Luv]] and [[Muv-Luv Alternative]].

Takeru was voiced by [[Hoshi Souichirou]] up until the [[muv-luv alternative (anime)|Alternative anime adaptation]], where the role was transferred to newcomer seiyuu Kamiki Kouichi. He's voiced by "Stephen Fu":[https://www.behindthevoiceactors.com/Stephen-Fu/] in [[Project MIKHAIL]]'s English dub.

title: sakaki_chizuru
body:
Character from [[Muv-Luv]]. Class rep of [[Shirogane Takeru]]'s class, who often confronts him over his tardiness and lazy attitude towards school work. She has [[green eyes]] and [[very long hair|very long]] [[brown hair]] worn in [[twin braids]] with [[parted bangs]]. She also wears [[glasses]] and has notably [[thick eyebrows]].

She is almost always at odds with [[Ayamine Kei]].

Chizuru was voiced by [[Kurata Masayo]] up until the [[muv-luv alternative (anime)|Alternative anime adaptation]], where the role was transferred to [[Itou Miku]]. She's voiced by "Brittany Lauda":[https://www.behindthevoiceactors.com/Brittany-Lauda/] in [[Project MIKHAIL]]'s English dub.

title: mitsurugi_meiya
body:
A character from [[Muv-Luv]]. A rich girl and heir to the Mitsurugi Financial Group who suddenly moves in with [[Shirogane Takeru]] and proclaims her love for him in front of their entire class. She has [[blue eyes]] and [[blue hair|hair]], usually worn in a [[long hair|long]] [[ponytail]], and she is often seen with a [[katana]].

Meiya was voiced by Okushima Kazumi up until the [[muv-luv alternative (anime)|Alternative anime adaptation]], where the role was transferred to Nanami Karin. She's voiced by [[Kira Buckland]] in [[Project MIKHAIL]]'s English dub.

title: tamase_miki
body: Character from [[Muv-Luv]]. A small, cat-like girl in [[Shirogane Takeru]]'s class who is often treated as the class pet by their classmates. She has [[green eyes]] and [[long hair|long]] [[pink hair]] worn in [[twintails]] with [[yellow ribbon|yellow]] [[hair ribbon|ribbons]] and [[hair ears]], and she is often seen wearing a [[neck bell]] and [[cat tail]].

title: project_mikhail
body:
A [[Muv-Luv Alternative]] [[mecha]] action game released for Steam in early access on November 1, 2021. A [[Nintendo Switch]] version is planned for the game's final release.

The English release lists the game as [b]Project MIKHAIL: A Muv-Luv War Story[/b]. It is the first (and currently only) release in the franchise to feature English dubbing for the original VN's cast.

title: ayamine_kei
body:
Character from [[Muv-Luv]]. A girl of few words in [[Shirogane Takeru]]'s class, known for often cutting class and her love of [[yakisoba]]. She has [[purple eyes]] and [[medium hair|medium]] [[black hair]], and has the [[large breasts|largest breasts]] of the main cast.

She is almost always at odds with [[Sakaki Chizuru]].

title: try_to_scream..._and_i'll_choke_you_with_my_breasts_(meme)
body:
[[Meme]] referencing a panel from the manga adaptation of [[Muv-Luv Alternative]]. In the original panel, [[Ayamine Kei]] [[kabedon]]s [[Shirogane Takeru]] while covering his mouth, with the dialogue "Try to scream... and I'll choke you with my breasts." 

h4. See Also
* "The original panel":[https://cdn.donmai.us/original/65/52/6552990580f2147e15e3b28748afea53.jpg]

title: pac-man_(game)
body:
A classic, influential and very popular [[Japan]]ese [[arcade]] [[video game]] designed by "Iwatani Toru":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Toru_Iwatani], published by [[Namco]] and first released in Japan on May 22, 1980. 

In 1982, [[Atari]] Inc. of America released the first game console version of the game for its [[Atari 2600]] console. It received bad reviews, but nevertheless, managed to become the best selling Atari 2600 game of all time; it sold an estimated 7 million copies, and was considered the best-selling home video game of all time when it was released

h4. See also

* [[Pac-Man]] (character)
* [[Blinky (pac-man)|]]

* [[Clyde (pac-man)|]]

title: thomas_edison_(fate)
body:
A Caster-class Servant in [[Fate/Grand Order]], a depiction of the (in)famous inventor and businessman of the same name.

He's tall and [[muscular]], has a white lion head, and wears a [[blue bodysuit]] and [[red gloves]]. In his ascension, he has light bulbs on both shoulders and rainbow wings.

[spoilers]His appearance is a result of an attempt by the government of the [[united states|United States]] to create a servant that is "the manifestation of the American Dream" to protect the country by merging his heroic spirit with various heroic spirits of United States presidents and the concept of [i]American Dream[/i]. Essentially turned Edison into a physical manifestation of the United States.[/spoilers]

Designed by [[Pako (pakosun)|]] and voiced by [[Terashima Takuma]].

Be careful not to confuse Edison with [[Boggart (fate)|]], who is likewise a white lion humanoid from the Britain Lostbelt.

h4.Costumes

* [[thomas edison (meat wars) (fate)|Meat Wars]]
* [[thomas edison (pakocure) (fate)|Pakocure]]
* [[thomas edison (planet rock) (fate)|Planet Rock]]
* [[thomas edison (junk shop) (fate)|Junk Shop]]

title: boggart_(fate)
body:
NPC introduced in the Britain Lostbelt of [[Fate/Grand Order]]. The Lord of Sheffield who takes [[Mash Kyrielight]] as his wife for political reasons. He is building up a rebel force to overthrow [[Morgan Le Fay (fate)|]] so he can become king himself.

Since he looks like a white lion humanoid, be sure not to confuse him with [[Thomas Edison (fate)|]].

title: medb_(fate)
body:
Rider-class Servant seen in [[Fate/Grand Order]].

The Queen of Connacht in Irish mythology. Uses a riding crop in battle, and summons her wagon [spoiler]that she uses to kidnap men to sleep with her[/spoiler] as her Noble Phantasm. Infamous for her extreme hypersexuality, to the point where her skill in riding (a man) was one of the criteria for her Rider designation.

Designed by [[Takayama Kisai]] and voiced by [[Sakura Ayane]].

h4. Variants

body: Original character by [[jun (navigavi)|]]. She has [[long hair|long]], [[brown hair]] and [[orange eyes]]. She is characterized by her large appetite, often at the expense of her [[little sister (navigavi)|little sister]].

title: birching
body:
A form of physical punishment in which a bundle of leafless twigs bound together, called a birch rod, is used to strike a person's buttocks, back, or shoulders.

Despite being named a birch rod, the rod is composed of several twigs bundled together and does not have to be composed of [[birch tree]] twigs.

h4. See also

* [[Spanking]]
* [[Whipping]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia - Birching":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Birching]

body: A [[plant]] on which [[banana]]s grow. It is not an actual tree due to non-woody stem despite the size and has very large [[leaf|leaves]].

title: mesa
body:
An isolated, distinctly flat-topped [[hill]] or [[mountain]] that stands above the surrounding plains. They tend to be surrounded by steeply eroded [[cliff|cliffs]] on all sides. Mesas are usually found in arid, hot and dry regions where rock layers are horizontal.

As part of the natural landscape in the Southwestern United States, mesas are a common sight in [[cowboy western]] settings.

h4.See also
* [[canyon]]
* [[desert]]
* [[Tag Group:Locations]]

title: tundra
body:
A vast, flat, almost treeless cold biome found in Arctic region of Europe, Asia, and North America in which the subsoil is permanently frozen. Most of the vegetations there are low-growing [[plant]]s such as [[moss]] or few [[flower]]s. 

h1. See also
* [[nature]]
* [[plain]]
* [[snow]]
* [[Tag Group:Locations]]

title: weeds
body:

title: monster_truck
body:
A monster truck is a specialized off-road vehicle with heavy suspensions, four-wheel steering, and oversized tires designed for competition and entertainment uses.  Monster trucks are either purpose built or modified from existing vehicles.  Modified vehicles are commonly light-duty trucks, such as [[pickup truck]]s, or [[sports utility vehicle]]s, but many other types of motor vehicles can be made into a monster truck like [[car]]s and even school buses.
h1. See also
* [[List of Ground Vehicles]]
* [[racecar]]

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia: Monster truck":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Monster_truck]

title: promotions_(meme)
body:
An imageboard [[meme]] that involves a picture with a person's arms spread wide in triumph. 

The joke was based on the fact that people who posted porn in SFW imageboards would inevitably garnering more attention, and that the one whose their post is getting "promoted" to NSFW category (i.e the poster) should have known better.

h4. External links

* "Know Your Meme: Promotions":[https://knowyourmeme.com/memes/promotions]

title: chimney
body:
A vertical structure found on [[house]]s and common [[building]]s for venting combustion gases or [[smoke]] to the outside atmosphere. Generally made out of [[brick wall|bricks]].

For the similar object found on industrial plants, locomotives or ships, use [[smokestack]] instead.

title: soulcalibur_vi
body:
The seventh entry in the mainline [[SoulCalibur|Soul]] franchise published by [[Namco]]. Instead of continuing the timeline laid out in previous titles, the game positions itself as a soft reboot for the setting, offering a retelling of the events of SoulCalibur 1 with potentially some changed details, including new and returning characters not otherwise seen in the original game. This is evidenced by the initial trailers and gameplay demos showing off a young Mitsurugi and a living Sophitia. The game released worldwide on October 18, 2018 for XBOX One, Playstation 4, and PC (Steam).

[*1]: The strictly correct Romanization of 重機甲兵 (じゅうきこうへい) is unknown. In the story, the word is often read as "Biodiver (バイオダイバー)".

title: ryuu_ga_gotoku_2
body:
The second main installment of the [i][[Ryuu ga Gotoku (series)|]][/i] series.

After the events of [i][[Ryuu ga Gotoku 1]][/i], ex-yakuza, [[Kiryu Kazuma]] is dragged back into Japan's underworld to help put a stop to a war between the Toujou Clan and Oumi Alliance instigated by [[Goda Ryuji]], who Kiryuu develops an intense rivalry for. Kiryuu is also helped by new allies such as [[Dojima Daigo]] and Sayama Kaoru.

A remake of [i]Ryuu ga Gotoku 2[/i], using the Dragon Engine seen in [i][[Ryuu ga Gotoku 6]][/i], was released in 2017 under the title [i]Ryuu ga Gotoku Kiwami 2[/i].

Also known as:
[i]Yakuza 2[/i]
[i]Yakuza Kiwami 2[/i]

title: adachi_koichi
body:
Supporting character in the [i][[Ryuu Ga Gotoku (series)|]][/i] series, he appears as a party member for [i][[Ryuu Ga Gotoku 7]][/i].

Adachi is a former [[police]] officer from the Kanagawa Prefecture. He seeks the help of [[Kasuga Ichiban]] as Adachi needs Kasuga's connections in order to help expose corruption within the police force.

Voiced by:
[[Ootsuka Akio]] (Japanese)
Andrew Morgado (English)

title: makimura_makoto
body:
A character that appears in [i][[Ryuu Ga Gotoku 0]][/i] as a major character and in [i][[Ryuu Ga Gotoku 2|Ryuu Ga Gotoku Kiwami 2]][/i] as a cameo.

She is a blind woman who meets [[Majima Goro]] when he attempts to assassinate her, but instead Majima resolves in trying to protect her from danger instead.

Voiced by [[Sawashiro Miyuki]].

title: ryuu_ga_gotoku_0
body:
The sixth main installment of the [i][[Ryuu Ga Gotoku (series)|]][/i] series.

It is the prequel to the entire [i][[Ryuu Ga Gotoku (series)|]][/i] series and it is set in the Japan's bubble economy during 1988.

It features [[Kiryu Kazuma]] and [[Majima Goro]] as playable protagonists as they get involved in a power struggle over a piece of land.

Also known as:
[i]Ryuu Ga Gotoku 0: Chikai no Basho[/i] ([i]Like a Dragon 0: The Promised Land[/i])
[i]Yakuza 0[/i]

title: majima_everywhere
body:
[[Ryuu ga Gotoku Kiwami]]'s game-specific mechanic, featuring [[Majima Goro]] ambushing protagonist [[Kiryu Kazuma]] in the most unlikely of places while wearing the most unlikely of costumes in order to "hone Kiryuu-chan's fighting skills".

The sheer absurdity of the above scenarios has led to it being memed among the Japanese and later global fanbase. Depictions of such will usually involve Majima popping out of a manhole, Majima wearing a police uniform, Majima crossdressing in a cabaret hostess or female idol costume, or Majima breaking a wall or door and entering a room [[Kool-Aid Man]]-style. Shouting "Kiryuu-chan!" optional but highly recommended.

This is also sometimes parodied using other characters in place of Majima. These will usually involve the "popping out of a manhole" variant, with said character lifting up the manhole cover with one arm while making a "shielding one's eyes to look far ahead" gesture, both in imitation of Majima's pose. Accompanied by their "title" and name as a caption. The character will also often suggest sage(-sounding) advice to another character while doing so.

title: date_makoto
body:
A recurring character in the [i][[Ryuu ga Gotoku (series)|]][/i] series. 

Date is a police detective who had a falling out with his family thanks to the events that involved [[Kiryu Kazuma]] prior to [i][[Ryuu ga Gotoku 1]][/i] and seeks to find the truth behind them. He helps [[Kiryu Kazuma|Kiryuu]] throughout the game and soon becomes one of his closest allies in the series.

Voiced by:
Yamaji Kazuhiro (Japanese)
Bill Farmer (English)

title: nishikiyama_akira
body:
A major character in the [i][[Ryuu ga Gotoku (series)|]][/i] series, appearing in [i][[Ryuu ga Gotoku 1]][/i] and [i][[Ryuu ga Gotoku 0]][/i].

Nishikiyama is the sworn brother of his childhood friend, [[Kiryu Kazuma]]. He has a lively and loyal personality but under the surface, harbors a huge inferiority complex. However, after Kiryuu's imprisonment, he became power-hungry and ambitious which eventually resulted in his betrayal of those once close to him.

Voiced by:
Nakaya Kazuhiro (Japanese)
Michael Rosenbaum (English)

title: kasuga_ichiban
body:
The protagonist of the [i][[Ryuu Ga Gotoku (series)|]][/i] series, succeeding [[Kiryu Kazuma]] from [i][[Ryuu Ga Gotoku 7]][/i] onwards.

A former member of the Arakawa Family, Kasuga is a passionate and out-spoken bottom-barrel [[yakuza]] with a strong sense of justice who lived most of his younger days playing [i][[Dragon Quest]][/i]. Because of this, he imagines every fight as a RPG battle and relies on teamwork with his friends in order to fight stronger opponents.

Voiced by:
Nakaya Kazuhiro (Japanese)
Kaiji Tang (English)

title: ryuu_ga_gotoku_3
body:
The third main installment of the Ryuu ga Gotoku series.

[[Kiryu Kazuma]] and his adoptive daughter, [[Sawamura Haruka]] move to Okinawa to run an orphanage and to leave behind Kiryuu's yakuza ties. However, he becomes involved once his orphanage is at risk of being demolished as it is on land required for government plans. While in Okinawa, Kiryuu befriends [[Shimabukuro Rikiya]] of the local Ryuudou Family.

Also known as:
[i]Yakuza 3[/i]

title: akiyama_shun
body:
A recurring [i][[Ryuu ga Gotoku (series)|]][/i] character that debuted in [i][[Ryuu ga Gotoku 4]][/i] and returns in [i][[Ryuu ga Gotoku 5]][/i] as a playable protagonist. He is moneylender nicknamed "The Lifeline of Kamurocho". He originally was a banker until he became homeless due to being framed for a money embezzlement scheme. However, the events of [i][[Ryuu ga Gotoku 1]][/i] where [spoiler]the explosion of the Millennium Tower scattered large amounts of yen[/spoiler] allowed Akiyama to invest his money to build a fortune.

Akiyama generally has a very laidback, unprofessional and disorganised personality, much to the chagrin of his secretary. He soon becomes a very close ally to [[Kiryu Kazuma]], even helping his adoptive daughter [[Sawamura Haruka]] investigate and traverse across the dangerous idol industry in Osaka. His fighting style revolves around sharp, rapid and swift kicks.

He is voiced by [[Yamadera Kouichi]].

title: kuze_daisaku
body:
A character in the [i][[Ryuu ga Gotoku (series)|]][/i] series, he appears as a major antagonist in [i][[Ryuu ga Gotoku 0]][/i].

One of the three lieutenants of the Toujou Clan's Dojima Family, Kuze is infamous for his tenacity and determination. He continuously appears as an adversary to main character, [[Kiryu Kazuma]] throughout [i][[Ryuu ga Gotoku 0]][/i]'s story. His fighting style consists of boxing and rare kick attacks.

Portrayed by:
Ozawa Hitoshi

title: ryuu_ga_gotoku_4
body:
Fourth main installment of the [i][[Ryuu Ga Gotoku (series)|]][/i] series.

This is the first time where multiple protagonists appear in the games alongside [[Kiryu Kazuma]].
The other protagonists are [[Akiyama Shun]], [[Saejima Taiga]] and [[Tanimura Masayoshi]].

The game has the four protagonists trying to decipher an event that happened 25 years ago that recently resurfaced as tensions among yakuza clans begin to appear.

Also known as:
[i]Ryuu Ga Gotoku 4: Densetsu o Tsugumono[/i] ([i]Like a Dragon 4: Successor of a Legend[/i]
[i]Yakuza 4[/i]

title: kuroda_takaya
body: [[Real life|Real-life]] Japanese voice actor. Most famous for voicing [[Kiryu Kazuma]] in the [[Ryuu ga Gotoku (series)|]] (AKA [i]Yakuza[/i]) series of video games.

title: ryuu_ga_gotoku_1
body:
The first main installment of the [i][[Ryuu ga Gotoku (series)|]][/i] series.

After spending 10 years in prison for taking the fall of a murder committed by his [[Nishikiyama Akira|best friend]], former yakuza, [[Kiryu Kazuma]] tries to investigate the events that transpired while he was absent. While investigating, he meets allies such as police detective, [[Date Makoto]] and a child linked to one of Kiryuu's childhood friends, [[Sawamura Haruka]].

Received a remake in 2016 in the [i][[Ryuu ga Gotoku 0]][/i] engine, titled [i][[Ryuu ga Gotoku Kiwami]][/i]. 

Also known as:
[i]Yakuza[/i]
[i]Yakuza Kiwami[/i]

title: ryuu_ga_gotoku_5
body:
The fifth main installment of the [i][[Ryuu Ga Gotoku (series)|]][/i] series.

It features five protagonists, [[Kiryu Kazuma]], [[Akiyama Shun]], [[Sawamura Haruka]], [[Saejima Taiga]] and [[Shinada Tatsuo]].

The five protagonists become involved in an all-out [[yakuza]] war, spanning from Fukuoka, Sapporo, Nagoya, Osaka and Tokyo.

Also known as:
[i]Ryuu Ga Gotoku 5: Yume, Kanaeshi Mono[/i] ([i]Like a Dragon 5: Fulfiller of Dreams[/i])
[i]Yakuza 5[/i]

title: strangulation_mark
body:
A pressure mark on the neck caused by [[hanging]], [[garrote]] or other methods of strangulation, such as hands ("example":[/posts/5214183?q=hands+asphyxiation+]). 

It may lead to [[unconscious]]ness or [[death]] by causing [[asphyxiation]].

title: jilpoong17

On November 21, 2014, he unfortunately passed away due to a stroke. "Obituary post":http://nyadiof.egloos.com/5855468

title: ben_chang
body:

title: shirley_bennett
body:
One of the main characters of the [[Community (series)|]] comedy series by Dan Harmon. Played by actress "Yvette Nicole Brown":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yvette_Nicole_Brown .

[b]Shirley Bennett[/b] is a divorcee mother of two who loves cooking. Became a community college student to obtain a marketing degree and start her own business.

[i]She is the worst[/i].

body:

Was known as "Annie Adderall" in high school.

title: pierce_hawthorne
body:

Became a community college student out of boredom several years ago.

title: jeff_winger
body:
One of the main characters of the [[Community (series)|]] comedy series by Dan Harmon. Played by actor "Joel McHale":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Joel_McHale .

title: community_(series)
body:
Notable live action American comedy series produced by NBC and written by Dan Harmon (creator of [[Rick and Morty]]).

Set in a community college, the show has a very large and varied ensemble cast with several comedians and popular actors.

It ran for 6 seasons (2009-2015) and lasted 110 episodes.

body:
The player character of [[hades_1|Hades]]. Prince of the Underworld, and son of [[hades_(hades)|Hades]] himself.

He has [[black hair]] and [[heterochromia|differently-colored eyes]], with one eye being [[red_eyes|red]] and the other being [[green_eyes|green]] (with his red eye having [[black sclera]]). He wears a [[laurel crown]] on his head and [[Ancient greek clothes]] with red [[leggings]] and three dog [[skull|skulls]] on one shoulder, and is always [[barefoot]].

title: libeccio_(kancolle)_(cosplay)
body:
[[Cosplay]]s of [[Kantai Collection]]'s [[libeccio (kancolle)|Libeccio]], or any of the Mastrale-class shipgirls in general.

Although Libeccio is not the nameship of her class, she was the first of her class introduced into the game. [[Maestrale (kancolle)|]], [[Grecale (kancolle)|]], and [[Scirocco (kancolle)|]], who started appearing in the game much, much later, wear otherwise identical uniforms as Libeccio. Therefore, this tag would be an umbrella tag for cosplays of any Maestrale-class girl unless there are visual cues or commentary specific to either Maestrale, Grecale, or Scirocco.

title: gemerl
body:
Character from the [[sonic_(series)|Sonic the Hedgehog]] series. A black and yellow [[robot]] created by [[Dr. Eggman]] after analyzing the data of [[emerl_(sonic)|Emerl]], a similar robot that was destroyed during the events of [[Sonic Battle]]. He would incorporate Gemerl in his mechs while facing off against [[sonic_the_hedgehog|Sonic]] and his friends in [[Sonic Advance 3]].

After the robot suddenly decides on its own to use the energy of the [[chaos_emerald|Chaos Emeralds]], Eggman temporarily joins hands with Sonic, then transformed into [[Super Sonic]] to stop it. Gemerl is eventually repaired and reprogrammed by [[tails_(sonic)|Tails]], and starts to live with [[Cream the Rabbit]] and her [[vanilla_the_rabbit|mother]].

title: they're_not_panties
body:
"They're not [[panties]], so it's not embarrassing!"

A "booster" line in [[Strike Witches]] wherein the speaker tells the listeners to forget that their [[underwear]] is exposed or treat their underwear as if they are "working" attire, or wearing something over them, probably to put their focus on their job instead.

The line is a self-aware joke about the premise of the series, in which the "witches" - various female pilots of a [[striker unit]] combat gear - do not wear anything on their bottom but their [[panties]], which is explained in-universe as to prevent their clothing from tangling with their striker unit.

Possibly said by [[Miyafuji Yoshika]] as she wears a [[school swimsuit]] [[swimsuit_under_clothes|underneath her uniform]] and technically not underwear.
other_names: パンツじゃないから恥ずかしくないもん!

title: shochuumimai
body:
Shochuumimai (or shochuu o-mimai) are postcards that people in Japan send to friends during midsummer. They typically contain the phrase "暑中(お)見舞い申し上げます" (shochuu (o-)mimai moushi agemasu), which means something like "seeing how you're doing this midsummer".

h4. See also

* [[zanshomimai]] (late summer)
* [[kanchuumimai]] (mid winter)

title: world_witches_series
body:
A mixed-media project originally created by [[Shimada Fumikane]] via a series of magazine illustration columns.

The series revolves around an alternate universe [[World War II]] scenario, and features various characters based on [[genderswap|genderswapped]] [[real life]] ace pilots dubbed "witches", donning a magic-powered gear called [[striker unit]] based on combat aircraft of that era.

h4. Tagging

If a character appeared in either the [[Strike Witches]] or [[Brave Witches]] series, even if they are not a part of the 501st or 502nd Joint Fighter squadrons, then the corresponding [b]Strike Witches[/b] or [b]Brave Witches[/b] tag should be added.

One caveat to this is...

* If a character from another unit or squadron that appeared in the anime/movie 
* Also appears with other members of their unit that did not appear in the anime/movie
* With none of the 501st/502nd members present

... they would not get tagged [[Strike Witches]]/[[Brave Witches]].

h4. Series

* [[Strike Witches: Suomus Misfits Squadron]]
* [[Strike Witches]]
* [[Tenkuu no Otome-tachi]]
* [[Witches Of Africa]]
* [[Strike Witches Zero]]
* [[Strike Witches: Katayoku no Majo-tachi]]
* [[Strike Witches: Kurenai no Majo-tachi]]
* [[Strike Witches: Aurora no Majo]]
* [[Noble Witches]]
* [[Brave Witches]]
* [[Luminous Witches]]

h4. See also
* [[They're not panties]]
* [[List of World Witches Series characters]]

title: time_lapse
body:
An image showing how something changes or the progression of an event overtime through the use of several “frames”. A considerate amount of time may pass between individual frames, making this tag different from [[sequential]] (in which at most seconds pass).

Usually, other than the main subject that is changing, the rest of the frames should remain mostly the same. (Ex: for a time lapse of a store, the angle/position at which the store is displayed in each panel is the same).

For the time-lapse of a work being drawn, see [[making-of]].

h4. See Also
* [[Progression]]
* [[fixed-point camera]]

title: fixed-point_camera
body:
Related to [[time lapse]] but denotes the POV of a fixed camera inside a room, instead of the actual passage of time.

* [[time lapse]]

title: nataruma
body:
A fictional female main character from the [[Orguss 02]] [[mecha]] anime series from the 90s.

[b]Nataruma[/b] is a strong willed brave girl with long [[black hair]] [spoilers]who is actually a descendant of [[Katsuragi Kei]] and [[Mimsy Raas]]. She is a Human/[[Emaan]] [[mutant]] hybrid with [[prehensile hair]] and special powers. Nataruma is transported to the original Emaan dimension at the end of the sequel series.[/spoilers]

title: mimsy_raas
body:
A female character from the [[Choujikuu Seiki Orguss]] [[mecha]] anime [[science fiction]] TV series from the 80s. 

[b]Mimsy Raas[/b] (ミムジィ・ラース [i]Mimujī Rāsu[/i]) is a crew member of the [i]Glomar[/i] [[Emaan]] trading airship.

[spoilers]In the sequel OVA [[Orguss 02]] it is revealed that Mimsy was pregnant with [[Katsuragi Kei]]'s daughter and that she was transported to an alternate Earth. She later dies due to a disease and her daughter [[Nataruma]], a Human/[[Emaan]] [[mutant]] hybrid with [[prehensile hair]] and special powers, is herself transported to the original Emaan dimension at the end of the sequel series.[/spoilers]

body:
A method, similar to [[tied shirt]], of wearing a [[jacket]] so that the [[midriff]] is exposed. May include either conventional-length jackets that have been modified, creating a [[crop top]], or those [[cropped jacket|specifically designed]] to be cropped. Notable wearers of the [[tied jacket]] include [[Agnes Tachyon (umamusume)|Agnes Tachyon]] and [[march 7th (honkai: star rail)|March 7th]].

This is not for cases of a [[jacket]]'s sleeves being tied shut individually or together.  For those, either [[sleeve tied shut]] or [[sleeves tied together]] as applicable.

title: storm_attacker
body:
A transformation mode first seen in the [[SDF-1]] [[spacecraft]] from the anime [[Choujikuu Yousai Macross]].

After a 15 minute modular transformation the ship is modified to look like a giant [[robot]] and be able to fire its main weapon. It is also the only mode where the ship is able to perform the [[Daedalus Attack]].

This mode has been used also in other spaceships that have appeared in the [[Macross]] series.

h4. Spaceships That Feature This Mode: 

* SDF-1 Macross ([b][i]The Super Dimension Fortress Macross[/i][/b])
* [[Battle 7]] ([b][i][[Macross 7]][/i][/b])
* [[Battle Frontier]] ([b][i][[Macross Frontier]][/i][/b])
* [[Battle Galaxy]] ([b][i]Macross Frontier[/i][/b])
* [[Macross Quarter]] ([b][i]Macross Frontier[/i][/b])

title: boddole_zer
body:
An antagonist humanoid [[alien]] character from the [[Macross]] [[mecha]] anime [[science fiction]] universe.

[b]Golg Boddole Zer[/b] is the supreme commander of the [[Zentradi]] 4,795,122 ship strong 118th Golg main fleet.

In the [[Macross: Do You Remember Love?]] anime film he was re-imagined as a massive living combat [[space station]].

The name of the character was changed to [b]Dolza[/b] in the [[ROBOTECH]] American adaptation.

title: eva_01
body:
(エヴァしょごうき, [i]EVA Shogouki[/i])

A [[mecha]] in [[Neon Genesis Evangelion]], piloted by [[Ikari Shinji]]. 

Arguably the most famous [[evangelion_(mecha)|Evangelion unit]], [b]EVA-01[/b] has a predominantly purple body with neon green highlights, yellowish eyes and a characteristic [[single horn]] that distinguishes it from the other EVAs. 

[spoiler]It has the hidden ability to go berserk, in which case its eyes glow red and a large mouth opens itself from the Evangelion's faceplate. In [[Evangelion: 2.0 You Can (Not) Advance]], the unit undergoes a process called "Pseudo-Evolution" after devouring [[Zeruel (evangelion)|]], where its green highlights become red and a shining [[halo]] materialises around the horn. In this form, the unit's left arm may or may not be a glowing construct.

In the original series it is revealed that [[Ikari Yui]]'s essence fused with the mecha during a pilot test, turning it into Shinji's actual mother.[/spoiler]
other_names: エヴァンゲリオン初号機

title: touhou_danmaku_kagura
body:
[[Touhou]] mobile rhythm game developed by AQUA STYLE and published by DeNA & Xeen, under the collective title 'Unknown X'. The original mobile game released on August 4, 2021 and ended service on October 28, 2022. The day service ended, a standalone re-built version of Danmaku Kagura was announced for Steam, titled 'Touhou Danmaku Kagura: Phantasia Lost', alongside a crowdfunding effort. It would release on February 8, 2024.

h4. External links

* "Official Twitter":https://twitter.com/danmakuJP

title: wii_u
body:
[[Nintendo]]'s sixth home video [[game console]], successor to the [[Wii]]. Its main controller is the [[Wii U Gamepad]].

It competed with [[Sony]]'s [[PlayStation 4]] and [[Microsoft]]'s [[Xbox One]] as part of the eighth generation of video game consoles.

The console was considered a failure for numerous reasons and had a short lifespan. It was succeeded by the much more well-managed [[Nintendo Switch]].
h4. See also
* [[List of game consoles]]

title: wii
body:
[[Nintendo]]'s fifth home video [[game console]]. Formerly known as the "Revolution". The original model was released in 2006 and a reconfigured version was released in 2011.

The [b]Wii[/b] competes with [[Sony]]'s [[PlayStation 3]] and [[Microsoft]]'s [[Xbox 360]] as part of the seventh generation of video game consoles. 

The Wii has many advanced features compared to the previous Nintendo consoles. For example, the primary wireless controller, the [[Wii Remote]], can be used as a handheld pointing device and detects movement in three dimensions. Another notable feature of the console is WiiConnect24, which enables it to receive messages and updates over the Internet while in standby mode.

The Wii is Nintendo's fifth home console, and the successor of the Nintendo [[GameCube]], with most models being fully backwardly compatible with all GameCube games and most accessories.

It was succeeded by the [[Wii U]].
h4. See also
* [[List of game consoles]]

title: sega_dreamcast
body:
[[SEGA]]'s final [[video game]] [[game_console|home console]] produced for the sixth-generation market of consoles. It was released in November 1998 in Japan and later in September 1999 in other territories. 

Sega ultimately had to withdraw from the console market when it couldn't compete against [[Sony]]'s [[Playstation 2]] and [[Nintendo]]'s [[Gamecube]], instead sticking to producing games. The company discontinued the Dreamcast in North America early in March 2001, but support for the system continued in Europe and Oceania until the end of 2002. In Japan consoles were still sold until 2007 and new licensed games continued to be released some time later. 10.6 million units were sold worldwide, as of 2002.

The [b]Dreamcast[/b] is still fondly remembered for several revolutionary games and pioneering home [[game_console|console]] online gaming.

h4.See also
* [[List of game consoles]]
* [[Tag Group:Video Game]]
* [[VMU]]

title: famicom_disk_system
body:
A peripheral for [[Nintendo]]'s [[famicom|Family Computer]], released only in Japan on February 21, 1986. It uses proprietary [[floppy disk|floppy disks]] called "Disk Cards" for cheaper data storage and it adds a new high-fidelity sound channel for supporting Disk System games.
h4. See also
* [[List of game consoles]]

title: sega_mark_iii
body:
The [b]SG-1000 Mark III[/b] (エスジー・セン [i]Esujī Sen III[/i]), also known as the [b]Sega Game 1000 Mark III[/b], is the original Japanese version of the [[Sega Master System]] [[video game]] [[game_console|console]] released in the mid 80s.
h4. See also
* [[List of game consoles]]

title: nes
body:
Short for [b]Nintendo Entertainment System[/b], it is the western version of the [[Famicom]] system, the first [[video game]] home console manufactured by [[Nintendo]]. It was first released in the USA in 1985.
h4. See also
* [[List of game consoles]]

h4. External links

* Photo comparison of "NES":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:NES-Console-Set.png and "Famicom":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Famicom-Console-Set.png.

title: sega_sg-1000_ii
body:
The [b]SG-1000 Mark II[/b] (エスジー・セン [i]Esujī Sen II[/i]), also known as the [b]Sega Game 1000 Mark II[/b], was a cartridge based [[video game]] home [[game_console|console]] manufactured by [[Sega]] and released in Japan, Australia, and other countries in the early 80s. 

The console was released in July 1984 as an improved version of the original [[Sega SG-1000]] console from a year before. It featured a few hardware tweaks from the original model, including detachable [[gamepad]]s and the ability to play Sega Card games. 

The Mark II did not sell well, however, leading to Sega's decision to continue work on its video game hardware. This would result in the release of the [[Sega Mark III]] in Japan in 1985, which later became the [[Sega Master System]] worldwide.
h4. See also
* [[List of game consoles]]

title: famicom
body:
Short for [b]Family Computer[/b], it was the first [[video game]] [[game_console|console]] manufactured and sold in Japan by [[Nintendo]] in July 15, 1983. It was redesigned and marketed as the [[NES]] in America 2 years later.
h4. See also
* [[List of game consoles]]

h4. External links

* Photo comparison of "Famicom":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Famicom-Console-Set.png and "NES":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:NES-Console-Set.png.

title: sega_sg-1000
body:
The [b]SG-1000[/b], also known as the [b]Sega Game 1000[/b], was a cartridge based [[video game]] [[game console|home console]] manufactured by [[Sega]] and released in Japan, Australia, and other countries in the early 80s. 

This system marked Sega's first entry into the home video game hardware business, and provided the basis for the more successful [[Sega Master System]]. 

It was first introduced in July 15, 1983. The SG-1000 was released on the same day that [[Nintendo]] released the [[Famicom]] in Japan. The console was developed in response to a downturn in arcades in 1982. The SG-1000 is not well remembered due to its poor performance, but served a role in the development of future Sega consoles.

The system was released in several forms, including the [[Sega SC-3000]] computer and the redesigned [[Sega SG-1000 II]], released a year later.

h4. See also
* [[List of game consoles]]
h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: SG-1000":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/SG-1000

title: atari_2600
body:
The [b]Atari 2600[/b], also known as the [b]Atari VCS[/b] ([b]Atari Video Computer System[/b]) before November 1982, is an old and classic home [[game console]] by [[Atari]], Inc. Released on September 11, 1977. It is credited with popularizing the use of microprocessor-based hardware and ROM [[game cartridge]]s containing [[video game]] code, a format first used with the [i]Fairchild Channel F[/i] video game console in 1976. 

This format contrasts with the older model of having non-microprocessor dedicated hardware, which could only play the games that were physically built into the unit (like in very early [[Pong]] game consoles).

The 2600 was a black and wood colored console typically bundled with [[television]] connectors and power [[cable]]s, two joystick [[game controller]]s, a conjoined pair of paddle controllers, and a game cartridge (initially "Combat", and later "[[pac-man_(game)|Pac-Man]]"). 

It was a very popular and successful machine. However, due to a cheap loyalty fee (that any game makers must paid to console owners for making a game for their system) and lack of quality control, the Atari 2600 was flooded with countless shovelwares that started to destroy its reputation. 

The release of the infamous [[E.T.]] video game (which Atari rushed in its development and produced too many copies of it for sale) it was later one of the causes for the subsequent "North America video game crash of 1983":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Video_game_crash_of_1983 , after which the system's popularity diminished greatly. By 1985 it was all but forgotten, but this paved the way for the introduction of more advanced and popular consoles like the [[Nintendo]] [[Famicom]] ([[NES]]) in the mid 80s.  

h4. Rival consoles from its era

* [[Intellivision]]
* [[ColecoVision]]
h4. See also
* [[List of game consoles]]

An Acquaint Fate is dark blue, and has a spherical cage joined together by a six-pointed flower surrounding a spiked core.

body:

title: oceanid_(genshin_impact)
body:
An enemy in [[Genshin Impact]].

A lifeform created from highly pure, condensed Hydro elements. They are often attached to bodies of water, and can create [[hydro_mimic_(genshin_impact)|Hydro mimics]] to fight for them.

Oceanids are capable of flight. Their body consists of a head with a singular white orb in it, a fish-like body with two three-pointed fins, and a forked tail fin. Most of their body is light blue, except for some darker patterns on the bases of their fins and white adornments wrapping around the head.

title: hydro_eidolon_(genshin_impact)
body:
A creature in [[genshin_impact|Genshin Impact]].

Hydro lifeforms found within the Veluriyam Mirage who are capable of transforming into various objects. They cannot speak, but often use emote icons to represent how they're feeling.

A Hydro Eidolon's body consists of three main spheres of water: one large central sphere, and two smaller spheres at its sides. An Eidolon may also transfer smaller drops of water between its lesser spheres and its central sphere while moving. An Eidolon has a large, single eye on its central sphere.

title: madura_no_tsubasa
body:
"The Wing of Madoola"

A platform game developed by [[SunSoft]] for the Nintendo Famicom in 1986. The game's plot greatly resembles that of [[Genmu Senki Leda]], which was released in 1985.

title: asagiri_youko
body:
朝霧 陽子 (あさぎり ようこ)

The main heroine of [[Genmu Senki Leda]], who writes a song that inadvertently acts as a bridge between Earth and its parallel world Ashanti. The overlord [[zell (genmu senki leda)|Zell]] wants to conquer Earth using this bridge, but the legendary warrior Leda prophesied Youko's arrival and gives her the ability to become a warrior.

She has [[long hair|long]] [[red hair]] kept in a [[side ponytail]] and wears metallic blue [[bikini armor]].

title: audio_visualizer
body:
Refers to animated imagery generated from a piece of [[music]] in real time, usually in the form of a series of pixelated bars (e.g. post #6141816) or series of straight bars with fluctuating heights (post #1718355).
Commonly seen in [[concert|concerts]] featuring electronic music or in [[mixing console|mixing consoles]].

Not to be confused with [[sound wave]].

title: kurokami_fubuki
body:
[[Shirakami Fubuki]]'s [[dark persona]]. She looks like a color-flipped version of the former: [[black hair]] and clothing and [[red eyes]].

In all respects, she is Fubuki's polar opposite, despising anything sweet and speaking in a sadistic, at times outright rude tone. She does not hesitate to do various "fan service" voiceovers (such as accepting various "marriage proposals"), albeit often making a demeaning remark to those who requested it. In practice, she serves to demonstrate Fubuki's wide vocal range.

* Usual full body (Dec 4, 2019 -): post #4543836
* Live2D model (Sep 6, 2022 -): post #5653168

They have performed two songs: Melty Fantasia (official costume: [[code:escape (idolmaster)|Code:EScape]]) and I.D ～EScape from Utopia～ (official costume: [[cipher:utopia (idolmaster)|Cipher:Utopia]]).

title: marquee_lights
body:
A line or grid of [[light_bulb|lightbulbs]]. Often flashing intermittently or in a chasing pattern to guide the attention of a viewer in a specific direction.
These can be used as a sign themselves (like an animated arrow, or glowing letters), around the outside border of a sign, or as decoration on and around the entrances of large buildings like hotels, theatres, casinos, and train stations.

Very commonly seen in [[circus]] and [[movie_theater|movie theater]] aesthetics, or as the lightbulbs around the [[mirror]] of a [[vanity_table|vanity table]].

h4. External links

* https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marquee_(structure)

title: chocolate_tart
body: A dessert consisting of dark [[chocolate]], [[cream]], and [[egg]]s whisked together, poured into a sweetened, crispy [[pastry]] shell, and baked until firm. Because of its egg-based filling, it is considered a type of custard [[tart (food)|]]. This dish is similar to chocolate [[mousse (food)|]], but the baking process gives the chocolate tart a firmer texture.

body: A light and airy dish that can be sweet or savoury, made with whipped egg whites, cream, or both, and flavoured with various ingredients. Often served chilled or frozen, and sometimes shaped into molds.

title: makizushi
body:
[b]Makizushi[/b] (巻き寿司, lit. "rolled sushi") is a type of long cylindrical [[sushi]], usually rolled in [[nori (seaweed)]] sheets. A thick roll is called 太巻き ([i]Futomaki[/i]) and a thin roll is called 細巻き ([i]Hosomaki[/i]). For posts where the seaweed is on the inside of the roll, see [[uramaki]].

Normally makizushi are cut into several pieces, but uncut rolls of makizushi are eaten as [[ehoumaki]].

Makizushi is often portrayed as a [[phallic symbol]] and used to perform [[simulated fellatio]].

h4. See also

* [[sushi]]
* [[Tag group:Food Tags]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Makizushi":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sushi#Makizushi
